loans.name: Ofik

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Ofik from Amberd village. She lives there with her family: her two sons, daughter-in-law, two grandchildren and husband. Ofik's husband went to a neighboring country as a migrant worker with the hope of helping his family financially. 

Now, the family's only source of income is agriculture. Ofik and her sons cultivate land and keep hens. They get harvest from haricot, potatoes, cucumbers, greens and watermelon, and they sell the final produce in local markets. Ofik has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and to cover cultivation costs and hiring workers for land cultivation work. Because the arable land is very big, it is very important for Ofik and her sons to get support and organize the cultivation work. 

As this is Ofik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Ofik get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Ofik hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides, and to cover cultivation costs and hiring workers for land cultivation work.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María, de 26 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, está acompañada, vive con su pareja y su hijo de 4 años de edad, quien pronto iniciara sus estudios de parvularia.

María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas todos los días de la semana y los fines de semana hace tamales para vender, esta actividad la aprendió de su abuela, quien dedicó la mayor parte de su vida a la venta de tortillas y tamales en su municipio, para realizar esta actividad se suma la ayuda de una de sus mejores amigas, quien le ayuda todos los días por las mañanas.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar cemento, ladrillos, hierro, entre otros materiales, también una parte del dinero la utilizara para comprar maíz para la venta de tortillas.- Anteriormente, ella había solicitado un crédito para para el mejoramiento de su casa y ahora con este segundo financiamiento la ampliará, ya que construirá un cuarto más.

Los sueños de María, son fortalecer su negocio y hacerlo más formal, ya que planea construir instalaciones adecuadas para trabajar todos los días, también planea vender desayunos y almuerzos, todo con el fin de salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
María, 26 years old, is a person who is very dedicated to her family. She is in a relationship. She lives with her partner and her 4-year-old son, who will soon start nursery school.

María sells tortillas every day of the week, and on the weekends she makes tamales to sell. She learned this work from her grandmother, who spent most of her life selling tortillas and tamales in her municipality. To do this work she has the help of one of her best friends, who helps her every day in the mornings.

The money from the loan will be used to buy cement, bricks, and iron, among other materials. Also, she will use part of the money to buy corn for the tortilla sales. Previously she had asked for a loan to improve her house and now with this second loan she will expand it, since she will build one more room.

María's dreams are to strengthen her business and make it more formal, since she plans to build facilities appropriate for working every day. She also plans to sell breakfast and lunch, all with the goal of moving ahead with her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and iron, among other materials. Also, she will use part of the money to buy corn for tortilla sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to buy a better quality seed.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es un hombre de 38 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijas de las edades entre 6 y 9 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Leonardo para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas típicas, él tiene dos años de realizar esta labor.
Leonardo es un gran artesano que elabora las mejores mochilas típicas de su pueblo, es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo para poder comprar una máquina de coser y mejorar los estilos de sus mochilas.
El gran sueño de Leonardo es poder tener una maquila con la que pueda producir sus artesanías y ser reconocido por todo su país.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a 38 year-old man who is married and has a beautiful family that includes 2 daughters between the ages of 6 and 9.  This humble family lives in a community in Chichicastenango.  

In order to obtain income and get ahead with his family, Leonardo has a business making traditional backpacks.  He's been doing this work for 2 years.  Leonardo is a great artisan who makes the best traditional backpacks in his town.  This is why he is now requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine, so that he can improve the styles of his backpacks.

Leonardo's greatest dream is to be able to have a factory where he could produce his handicrafts and become known throughout the country.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Diara's Group

texts.fr: Diara qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, portant un foulard orange , est membre d’un groupe de 17 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sirakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Diara, âgée de 63 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 28 à 41 ans. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture qui lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Diara à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Diara cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Diara entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Diara effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Diara cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Diara planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Diara espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Diara, who is in the first row on the right in the photo, wearing an orange headscarf, is a member of a group of 17 farmers registered in myAgro, living and working in the village of Sirakoro in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Diara, aged 63, is the mother of seven children aged 28 to 41. Family tradition being anchored in agriculture, principle source of revenue and of food self-sufficiency for the household, but also the fact that agriculture has allowed her to ensure self-sufficiency for her family moved Diara to work in this field for 50 years now.

Diara cultivates peanuts on her plot but as a farmer she also has to face difficulties such as lack of rain, of farm supplies, and of high-quality fertilizer. Diara is beginning her first year with myAgro and she registered because of the system of payment and the high-quality seeds and fertilizer.

This year Diara is making payments to purchase a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts in order to expand the yield on her plot of 0.0625 hectare. Diara has been growing peanuts for 40 years now for their value as a foodstuff, explaining the peanuts are directly edible by the family and are utilized as a basic sauce in cooking. They also have commercial value, since peanuts are a foodstuff she sells at the market.

With the increase of her yield and her income, Diara plans to expand her farmed land and buy farm supplies. Finally, she also hopes to be able to ensure food self-sufficiency for the family.

loans.use: to acquire a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts, in order to increase the agricultural productivity of her plot of land

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 35 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her two sons and two daughters.  Her children are in school.  Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 12 years. He is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. 

Therefore Rabia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 
Rabia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase the stock at her husband's clothing business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year- old, married man, from Jabalia City. He is a father of two sons and two little daughter. Before the last violence in Gaza, Ahmad was living with his family in a small house. Their house was destroyed during that.  Ahmad rented a small apartment in the same area. 

Recently, Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for credit and development – FATEN to rebuild his house. After he gets the loan, he will be able to complete the construction of his house in a short time and  he and his family will return to their normal life.
Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his house that was destroyed in the war, so that he and his family may return to a normal life.

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Iris es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada al su negocio, el cual es la venta de cerdos para engorde, esto lo realiza hace mas de 15 años, su negocio se ubica en su casa de habitación y también tiene cría de cerdos, sus principales clientes son vecinos de su comunidad que se dedican al destazo de cerdos.
Doña  Iris solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de dos cerdos para engorde compra de concentrado para el mismo y compra de dos cerdas  para aumentar la venta de cerdos pequeños, está muy agradecida ya que con el apoyo del crédito anterior, logro vender y obtener buenas ganancias.
Doña Iris sueña con tener una porqueriza con todo lo necesario para tener 15 cerdos y poder aumentar sus ventas.

Danli,  Honduras -  Mayo del 2015
texts.en:
Iris is a hardworking woman who is devoted to her business, which is selling pigs to fatten.  She started in this line of work more than 15 years ago.  Her business is located on her property, and she also raises pigs there.  Her main customers are neighbors in her community that have businesses butchering pigs.

Iris is requesting a loan to buy 2 pigs to fatten, and also to buy pig feed for them.  This will increase her business selling pigs.  She is very grateful to be getting this loan, because with her last loan she was able to sell more and generate good earnings.  

Iris dreams of having a pigsty that is equipped to handle 15 pigs so that she could increase her sales

Danli,  Honduras -  May 2015

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush is from Aygabats village of Shirak region where she lives with her husband and three children. They all are involved in farming. Currently, Haykanush and her family keep livestock of four cows, calves and hens. They also cultivate wheat, barley and potatoes. Because the girls have too much work to do on the farm and in the house, Haykanush's husband is the only one who takes the gathered harvest to the market and sells it there. 

By applying for this loan Haykanush asks lenders to support her with the development of the farm. She plans to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer needed for the farm.
Because the region where Haykanush's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate there is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Haykanush's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer needed for the development of the farm

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Pathani has successfully built her business of hand embroidery with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva.  She has now attained a good number of customers and makes a better amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of beads, needles and glittering material to meet customers’ orders on time to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of beads, needles and glittering material to meet customers’ orders on time to gain more profits.

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beka is a 32-year-old, from Ambrolauri district. He lives with his wife, who is a housekeeper, and two children. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of income and live under poverty.  According to above-mentioned situation, Beka lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The StartUp program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of 1,000 USD. 

With the requested amount, Beka plans to open a bakery locally in a good location, purchase all needed equipment, and start selling bread products. After the bakery is opened, the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs, as well as expand the business in the future.  With support of the StartUp program, Beka will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties. He awaits your support and kindness.

loans.use: to open a bakery and make the only source of income.

loans.name: Hamdan

texts.en:
Hamdan is 31-year-old man from Rafah City, married and father to two sons and a four daughters. 
Hamdan was living with his family in a small humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza, his house was destroyed completely, so he had to rent a small apartment in the same area.
 
Recently Hamdan took a USD loan from Palestine for credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his old house. The loan will allow Hamdan to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.
Hamdan appears in the photo.

loans.use: rebuild his family house that was destroyed in the war.  His family may then resume a normal life together.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиер целеустремленный мужчина привыкший добиваться всего сам. Ему 38 лет, он из района Дж.Руми.  Бахтиер женат, и отец троих детей. Его дети – это мотивация  ради них он живет и трудится. Он занимается продажей  хозтовары на рынке. Бахтиер 6 лет ведет свой бизнес. Он решил увеличить товарооборот, путем перевоза больше хостовары, и по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. За счет запрашиваемого кредита он хочет, привозит хозтовары на продажу. Надеемся, что у него все получится. Вы поддержите его финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en: Bahtiyor is an ambitious man who is used to achieving everything on his own. He is 38 years old and from the J.Rumi district. Bahtiyor is married and the father of three children. His children are his inspiration; he lives and works for them. He sells household products at the market and has been running his business for six years. He decided to increase his sales turnover by expanding his inventory, and this is why he applied for a loan. He wants to use the loan to bring in more household goods. He hopes for success.

loans.use: to increase his sales turnover and bring in more goods

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. Tigran is seriously busy with swine breeding in his farm. He has pigs and piglets, chickens and also large plot of land on which he cultivates vegetables and fruits for sale and also for his family use. The pork Tigran sells to his neighbors or to city butchers. The assortment of vegetables, such as tomato, cucumber, beans, cabbage, potatoes and greens he sells wholesale. His fruit garden is very nice and here has pear, fig, mulberry, apple and apricot trees. The fruit he also sells with the assortment of vegetables. 

Being the only bread-winner in his family, Tigarn works night and day to have farm products of high quality, in order to have more customers and more income from its sale. Tigran is married and he has two school-aged sons. His wife and his mother are housewives and they help Tigran about the farm greatly. With this loan Tigran wants to buy several pigs and also a lot of fodder for all his farm pigs.

loans.use: to buy several pigs and also a lot of fodder for all his farm pigs

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo tiene 58 años de edad, vive en armonía familiar con su cónyuge en una comunidad pequeña dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de esparcimiento en su local campestre ubicado en su distrito, donde frecuentan personas del mismo distrito, caseríos cercanos y personas que vienen de visita, su local cuenta con campos deportivos, juegos para niños y venta de comida y cerveza, realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años. Adicionalmente el se dedica a la carpintería, fabrica todo tipo de muebles de madera, es albañil y también es pintor. El destino del crédito será para realizar arreglos y mejoramiento de su local de esparcimiento, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su recreo para brindar una mejor atención, lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y va a permitirle mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 58 years old and lives happily with his partner in a small community whose main industries are agriculture and ranching. It is located in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountain region.

He has a game shop in his community, where community members, neighbors, and tourists visit. He has sports games and children's games and also sells food and beer. He has had this business for the past 5 years. He also works in carpentry; he makes all types of wooden furniture. He is a bricklayer and a painter.

He will use the loan to make repairs and improve his game shop. He hopes to earn more income so that he can improve his shop and increase the number of customers. This will have a positive impact on his income and will permit him to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs and improve his game shop.

loans.name: Gs Dios Proveera Group

texts.es:
Wendy es una persona emprendedora y dedicada al comercio su fuente principal de ingresos proviene de su negocio, venta de verduras, este negocio lo atiende de manera personal y se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, esto lo realiza desde hace 3 años, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación, sus principales clientes son vecinos de su comunidad y de otras comunidades.
Wendy solicita el apoyo del Préstamo para la compra de verduras como ser: tomates, remolacha, pepinos, aguacates, repollos, patastes, zanahoria etc. Wendy sueña con poder extender su negocio y vender de forma mayorista a las diferentes comunidades y ciudades vecinas, y así poder mejorar su fuente de ingresos y calidad de vida.
Wendy solicita el apoyo del préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas: Glenda, se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace 16 años y Arcadia se dedica a la venta de abarrotería y ropa interior desde hace10 años ellas solicitan el préstamo porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente para invertir en sus negocios. Ellos aparecen con Eugenia quien también forma parte del grupo pero en estos momentos no invertira en su negocio de venta de pan.


Honduras Abril 2015
texts.en:
Wendy is an entrepreneurial person and works in commerce. Her main source of income is her vegetable sales business. She tends to the business herself and wakes up very early to serve her customers. She has been doing this for the past 3 years. Her business is located in her home and her customers are neighbors and people from other communities.

Wendy requests a loan to purchase tomatoes, beets, cucumbers, avocados, cabbage, chayote squash, carrots, etc. She dreams of being able to expand her business and sell products in bulk to different communities and neighboring cities so that she could increase her income and improve her quality of life.

Wendy requests a group loan with Glenda, who has sold fruit for 16 years, and Arcadia, who has sold groceries and undergarments for 10 years. They are requesting a loan because they don't have sufficient capital to invest in their business. They are shown in the photo with Eugenia, who is a member of the group but is not currently investing in her bread sales business.

Honduras - April 2015

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, beets, cucumbers, avocados, cabbage, chayote squash, carrots, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Santa Beatriz Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SANTA BEATRIZ, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Juana  tiene 62 años de edad es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra  de abono y semillas.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia  que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank Santa Beatriz, the bank is located in the district of Maranura, province of La Convencion and department of Cusco.
Juana is 62, single and has 1 child. She alternates her daily activities with working growing fruits.  She has been doing this for a long time and does well thanks to the hard work she puts in each day into her business.  The member wishes to be able to continue working to support her family.
The member requests a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.
The members are grateful for the loan provided and commit to meet the repayment schedule.
The member photo added in the group photo asked for permission to be late for the meeting due to work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Abuneri

texts.en: Abuneri is a 35-year-old married man, with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a pub, alongside buying and selling cocoa to supplement his income. With the proceeds, he has managed to pay fees for his children. His hardship is seasonal changes, thus receiving seasonal income. He hopes to expand his business and own a bigger cocoa store. He is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo de 31 años de edad habita en un municipio a  orilla del mar, donde se dedica a la producción de ropa femenina, masculina e infantil.    Hace 3 años Leonardo inició su generador de ingresos, impulsado desde muy joven por su madre, a quien como modista de toda la vida vio generar ingresos y le propuso a asociarse con ella, para producir además de ropa artículos de lencería. Leonardo aceptó su propuesta y hoy trabaja con su madre en su propio taller y realizan su comercialización puerta a puerta, entre amigos referidos y gente que potencialmente requiere acceder a sus productos. Su meta más adelante es mejorar su infraestructura técnica, comprando nuevas maquinarias y contratando operarias, pues finalmente su meta es ganar más dinero, con el propósito de remodelar su vivienda y con el gran desafío de fidelizar su clientela.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, hilos Y accesorios de lencería, para mejorar su negocio aumentando su productividad, sus ventas y utilidades, con lo cual haría de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 31 years old and lives in a city by the sea, where he makes a living producing clothing for women, men, and children. Leonardo began this work three years ago, driven from an early age by his mother, who is a longtime seamstress and proposed he work with her to generate income, and help her to make more than just lingerie items. Leonardo accepted her proposal and now works with his mother in thei own workshop and sells door to door, among friends, and to referrals. 

Leonardo's goal for the future is to improve his technical infrastructure, purchasing new machinery and hiring workers to help him achieve his ultimate goal of earning more money in order to remodel his home, and with the great challenge of retaining their customers. He is currently requesting a Kiva loan, the first loan he is requesting from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he will use to buy fabric, thread and lingerie accessories to improve his business, increasing productivity, sales and profits, which would make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and lingerie accessories for his clothing business.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is from Dzoravanq village where she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandson. Her husband and son teach at a local secondary school, while Maragit runs their family farm. She is broadly involved in agribusiness. Margarit keeps hens, 38 colonies of bees, cultivates a large variety of fruits and vegetables (crop, haricot, potato, cucumber, onion, garlic, cherry, plum, walnut, apple and pear). Margarit's husband helps her with beekeeping and selling the harvest in the local market. She applied for this loan to enlarge her farm by six oxen.

As this is Margarit's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Margarit get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Margarit hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for six oxen

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 27 лет, замужем. Она в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 40 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения и увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и покупку мебели.
texts.en: Aigul is 27 and married. She earns income for her family by raising livestock. Thanks to Aigul's hard work, she currently has 40 sheep and earns 18,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business in the future, Aigul applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy livestock to breed and increase her herd. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to continue expanding her business and to buy furniture.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a repeat client in Ugafode Microfinance Limited, having taken previously a loan of UGX 500,000. She is a married woman, age 40 years, and owns a restaurant in a bid to increase on her working capital and expand on her business. She has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000. However, she is faced with challenges of congestion in the market and competition.

Grace is one of the clients who testifies about what Ugafode Microfinance loans have helped her to achieve and is thankful to Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy food items for cooking and selling.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 34 years old from Baniswef. He is married with three children and takes care of his aging mother. He has a small grocery store project but he wishes to increase his sales in Ramadan and feast seasons so he requested a 6,000 EGP loan to buy a deep freezer and some grocery products such as frozen vegetables, oil, and pasta.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and some grocery products such as frozen vegetables, oil, and pasta.

loans.name: Rafiea

texts.en:
Rafiea  is 42 years old, married woman. She, along with her husband (who is also shown in the photo), is providing bookbinding services to the people of her locality. They are very experienced and manage to earn a reasonable amount of income to bear their household expenditures. They have become popular in their community and have retained many customers. She is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Rafiea  wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase binding materials such as card boards, binding tape and glue, along with the bundles of paper. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase book binding materials such as card boards, binding tape and glue, along with the bundles of paper.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase three pigs in order to raise them and later butcher them.

loans.name: El 21 Group

texts.es: Grupo ¨El 21¨ integrado por dos mujeres y un hombre. Quien lo coordina es Zacarias de 38 años, casado y con 3 hijos de edades de 4, 11, 14. Él se dedica a la venta de productos derivados del maíz en su domicilio. El obtuvo crédito anteriormente y nos expresa que con las ganancias obtenidas saco más productos y ofreció más variedad a su clientela. Ahora con el crédito actual desea invertirlo en la compra de maíz, leña, bolsa, rodamina y cacao. Ahora con  las ganancias desea construir su casa y hacer mas grande el negocio. Las demás integrantes son Heydi, de 23 años, ella vende ropa usada de forma ambulante en su comunidad. Y Ingrid de 20 años vende ropa usada desde hace 2 años en su comunidad.
texts.en: El 21 Group is made up of two women and one man. It is coordinated by Zacarias, who is 38, married, and has three children who are 4, 11, and 14.  He sells corn products from his home.  He received a loan before and he tells us that with the income he generated he put more products on offer and offered his clientele a wider variety.  With the current loan he wants to buy corn, firewood, bags, rhodamine, and cacao.  With his earnings he now wants to build a house and make his business bigger.  The other members are Heydi, who is 23; she sells used clothing door-to-door in her community.  And Ingrid who is 20 has sold used clothing in her community for two years.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, bags, rhodamine, and cacao

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en:
Remegio of Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to buy more maize, groundnuts, and coffee to sell. He still deals in produce, selling maize, groundnuts, and coffee as his main source of income, though he also practices farming to earn an extra income. He started this business to sustain his family and to educate his children. 

He faces challenges of weather changes that affect his produce business, lack of capital to meet the increasing demands, and stiff competition from other traders. He has a vision of expanding and diversifying his business. He is requesting a loan to buy more maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is a teacher from Armavir town. She lives there with her husband. Besides working at a local secondary school, Armine also provides individual classes at her house. She has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support her with her working room. She needs this loan to be able to purchase foreign literature, a computer, table and 12 chairs needed for her classroom. This loan will enable Armine to provide better conditions for her students and create more convenience for them.

Armine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Armine greatly hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to buy foreign literature, a computer, table and 12 chairs needed for the classroom.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a repeat client in UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, having previously taken three loans, each amounting to UGX 500,000. He is a married man, 30 years old, owning a retail shop where he sells phones and other electronic gadgets. 

Having wanted to increase his working capital and expand his business, Joseph has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. However, he is faced with the challenges of congestion in the market and competition.

Joseph is among the clients who testify about what UGAFODE Microfinance loans have helped them to achieve. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for the financial support given to the small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories, such as batteries, housings, and phone jackets.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат, 46 лет, замужем, есть 2 сыновей. У нее- среднее образование, 15 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 20 овец. Также имеется земельный надел, мерою 2,50 ГА, где Салтанат выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). Салтанат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Салтанат развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Saltanat is 46, married, and has two sons. She has a high school education and has been a farmer for 15 years, helping take care of her family by earning additional income. Thanks to Saltanat's hard work, she currently has four cows and 20 sheep, along with a 2.50 hectare plot of land where she grows beans. She earns 19,000 som (KGS) per month. Saltanat applied for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy ten sheep to fatten and sell. The earnings from the loan will help her to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Maria Edelina

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy trabajadora  tiene 45 años, ella vive con sus 3 hijos en la casa familiar en el barrio la Tola de la parroquia Natabuela en Atuntaqui. 
Actualmente está divorciada, ella trabaja sola, vendiendo yogurt, queso y leche esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años. Estos productos los vende de forma ambulante de puerta en puerta por las casas de su barrio, aprendió este oficio por el hermano que le  ayudo con 7 galones de yogurt para que pueda empezar su negocio, desde entonces ha ido incrementando su negocio invirtiendo cada vez más y en la actualidad es la principal fuente de ingresos de su hogar, además de estos productos ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.
Por el sector la gente se dedica a la venta de comida típica principalmente las fritadas de chancho que van acompañadas de papas, mote, aguacate, tostado, choclo, plátano y queso. El lugar más reconocido en la venta de este plato típico es las Fritadas amazonas a donde asisten turistas tanto nacionales como internacionales principalmente fines de semana y feriados.
El crédito que María solicita a fundación alternativa lo va invertir en la compra de yogurt, leche y queso ya que sus clientes se han ido incrementando y para poder cumplir con todos sus pedidos necesita incrementar su capital de trabajo, además gracias a esta oportunidad de crecimiento ella podrá ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hard-working woman. She is 45 years old, and she lives with her 3 children in a family home in the Tola neighborhood, which belongs to the Natabuela parish in Atuntaqui. Currently, she is divorced. She works alone, selling yogurt, cheese, and milk. She has been performing this work for the past 4 years. She sells her products as a street vendor, traveling from door to door among the houses in her neighborhood. She learned this work from her brother, who gave her 7 gallons of yogurt so that she could start her business. Since then, she has been expanding her business, investing more and more. At the moment, this business is the primary source of income of her household. In addition to these products, she sells cosmetics.

The people in this sector make a living selling traditional food, primarily fried pork that is accompanied by potatoes, corn, avocado, toast, plantains, and cheese. The place that is most well-known for the sale of this traditional dish is Fritadas Amazonas, a location that is visited by both national and international tourists mainly on weekends and holidays.

Maria will use the loan that she is requesting from Fundacion Alternativa to buy yogurt, milk, and cheese, since her number of customers has increased. In order to fulfill all of her orders, she needs to boost her working capital. Additionally, thanks to this opportunity to grow, she will be able to offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in order to serve her customers, who have increased in number.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es una de 32 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Felipa con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles, ella tiene cinco años de realizar esta labor.
Felipa gracias a la dedicación y esmero con el que elabora sus pasteles, tiene mucha clientela es por ello que ahora se ve a la necesidad de realizar un préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales como harina, royal, huevos y otros para poder cubrir la demanda que en su pastelería tiene.
El gran sueño de Felipa es poder tener una pastelería más grande para que sea reconocida a nivel nacional como pastelera y también comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Felipa is 32 years old; she is single and lives with her parents in a neighborhood of Sololá.

In order to generate income and support her parents with the household expenses, Felipa bakes cakes for a living; she has been doing this work for five years. 

Thanks to the dedication and care with which she makes her cakes, she has a large clientele, which is why she currently needs a loan to buy her materials, such as flour, Royal baking powder, eggs, and more to cover the demand at her cake shop.  

Felipa's greatest dream is to have a bigger cake shop so she will be known at the national level as a cake maker and also to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy flour, Royal baking powder, and eggs to make cakes

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 44 years old from Baniswef. He is married and has four children. He has a blacksmith project and he wishes to expand it. So, he requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE to purchase iron and modern tools to increase his income and guarantee decent living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to purchase iron and modern tools.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: Eva tiene 46 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza través de catálogos  hace más de un año. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de perfumes esmaltes joyas en fantasía fina que estén en oferta para poder expenderlos a un precio que le genere ganancias. Ella participa en el grupo “GOTITAS DE AMOR” El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Eva es la tercera del lado derecho vista casaca ploma
texts.en: Eva is 46 years old, and is married with 2 dependent children. She has made a living selling beauty products through catalogs for over a year. The loan will be invested in the purchase of perfume, nail polish, fine jewelry, and costume jewelry that are on sale. She can them sell them at a price that will generate profits. She participates in the group "DROPLETS OF LOVE" ("GOTITAS DE AMOR"). The group thanks the Kiva investors for their support. Eva is the third from the right, wearing the feather coat.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polish, and costume jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Fejal Mahila Mandal Group

texts.en:
This group of five enterprising, dedicated women hails from Dahod, India. They are led by Rukhsanabibi who is standing in the center. She is a 38-year-old mother of one child. She manages the household expenses and medical expenses single handedly. The household income is INR 12,500, which is insufficient to meet household expenses and pay for her child's education. The monthly savings are just INR 3,000. Hence, Rukhsanabibi thought of starting her business to supplement the family income. She started selling fruits, which include apples, mangos, bananas, pears, oranges, etc. With this business, she is currently earning INR 3,000, but she wants to earn more to support her child's education. Hence, she came up with the idea to avail a loan to expand her business. She got together with four other women who share similar interests. 

The other women are determined to help their families and want to expand their existing businesses. These families, on an average, earn INR 10,000 a month, out of which they are able to save only INR 2,000. Similar to Rukhsanabibi, Sajeda and Anjuben are also into selling fruits, which include apples, mangos, bananas, pears, oranges, etc. They will use the loan to expand their fruit selling businesses and earn more income. Yasamin has her own variety store where she sells bangles, earrings, ornaments etc. She will use the loan to expand her variety store. Apsanabibi is into tailoring and she stitches blouses, dresses and petticoats for women. She will use the loan to expand her tailoring business. Together the group seeks a loan of INR 72,000. Your loan will help these women earn better and give good education to their children. It will also pave a way for a good standard of living and happiness among these families.

loans.use: to expand her fruit selling business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  su esposo e hijos. Su negocio es el servicio de molino y venta de cerdos desde hace 9 años.
Doña luisa su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación y debido a que es un lugar muy céntrico tiene muchos clientes. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de herramientas para brindarle el mantenimiento necesario a su molino, así como también cerdos para seguir con su actividad. 
Doña Luisa con el préstamo espera que su negocio funcione de la mejor manera y así aumentar sus ingresos y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar, espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  comprar otro molino, con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y de esta forma darse una mejor calidad de vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Abril  del  2015
texts.en:
Luisa is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her husband and children.  Her business has been mill services and pig sales for nine years.  

Luisa's business is in her home, and because of its central location she has many customers.  She needs this loan to buy tools to perform necessary maintenance on her mill, as well as for pigs to continue with her business. 

Luisa hopes her business will run at its best with her loan and thereby generate income and, thanks to this, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life with the increase in household income; she hopes to make her business grow in the short term and buy another mill so she can keep supporting her family and give herself a better quality of life.  

Choluteca, Honduras – April,  2015

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and pigs for her businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete his house by buying doors, windows and cement

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg has nice and big family and they live in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. Gevorg is 33 years and he is already father of three children (two daughters and a son). Gevorg is a beloved and skilled father, who do his best through the farming to provide all his family with good living conditions. His farm is beautiful and it provides a good living for his family. 

Here he takes care of cows, calves, sheep, lambs and chickens. His nice wife sells their farm milk, cheese, meat and eggs. Gevorg mentions that he dreams of making the farm bigger and that he will be able to sell more meat since it is very profitable for each farmer. 

This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams he really hopes to receive which he will use for the purchase of a cow and also fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.use: purchase an extra cow and also fodder for his all farm cattle, so as to support his family even better than before

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Desde hace 27 años, Myriam fue impulsada por su esposo para que abriera al público un centro de educación , pues no habia uno que generara satisfaccion a los habitantes del municipio en este sector. Este proyecto fue muy acogido por los padresde familia y hoy despues de 27 años aun permanece y Myriam tiene muchos planes de crecer, pues tiene el propósito con aumentar cada vez mas la calidad del servicio educativo que ofrece inpulsada por su vocación.  En su establecimento se practica la educación prescolar y tambien los niveles de primaria, trabajan de lunes a viernes en el horario de 7 de la mañana a 1 de la tarde y los estudiantes  vecinos del barrio donde habita y sectores aledaños, son sus principales clientes. Su meta es lograr el mejoramiento de su infraestructura, mas adelante ampliar el local para ingresar nuevos estudiantes y aumentar su capacidad fisica de atender a muchos niños que hoy lo necesitan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará material didáctico y hará mantenimiento a los pizarrones , con el propósito de mejorar el ambiente escolar haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Twenty-seven years ago, Myriam's husband encouraged her to open a public education center, since there was no satisfactory one for the city dwellers in her area.  Myriam's project was  very well-accepted by heads of families, and today after 27 years is still in existence.  Myriam  has many plans for growth, since she aims to continually increase the quality of the educational service she offers, driven by her sense of mission.
  
The organization  provides preschool and primary level teaching, and is open from Monday through Friday from 7AM till 1PM.   Students who live in the neighborhood and nearby areas are the main customers.  Myriam's goal is to improve the infrastructure, and later increase the size of the school in order to allow more students and increase the physical capability to take care of many children now in need..  She is now applying for a Kiva loan, the first application she has made to the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  The loan will be used to purchase teaching materials and maintain the  chalkboards, with the aim of improving the school atmosphere, thus making a successful investment of this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy teaching material and maintain chalkboards

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela, who is a 40-year-old widowed woman, lives in Kutaisi city. She has two sons who are temporarily unemployed. Lela is the only breadwinner in the family, who has a stable job and gets a fixed salary. Her family, and especially the sons, requires additional income for progressing in life. Lela has a great desire somehow to increase the income of the family and has requested a loan for starting an additional business. 

Lela has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. With the requested amount, Lela will build a commercial space in the land that she owns, will renovate it, and rent out. With the help of Kiva lenders, Lela and her family members will get the chance to make a stable source of additional income. The loan will greatly assist Lela, and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: to build a commercial space and rent it.

loans.name: Martha Irma

texts.es: Martha de 68 años,  nació en una familia de comerciantes, a sus ocho años de edad  vivía con su tía, a quien le propuso que le enseñara a hacer pasteles de masa para venderlos todos  los domingos en la plaza. Cuando se casó en compañía de su cónyuge se trasladaron a la ciudad de Barranquilla y para generar ingresos adicionales su cuñado le propuso vender ropa interior y pijamas, así mismo ella permaneció desde su casa preparando comidas para la venta.  Continúo sus estudios de educación media y al graduarse como bachiller tomo cursos de modistería y pastelería; solo cosía a sus hijos y siguió en su negocio de comidas.  En la actualidad tiene un restaurante donde ofrece exquisitos platillos y todos los días en el horario de 5 a.m. a 10 a.m. se dedica a la elaboración de sus comidas, desayunos y almuerzos.  Martha está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de un congelador  y mejorar la imagen del restaurante al cambiarle el piso. Al mejorar la  apariencia del local la inversión promete incrementar la afluencia de clientes y con ello más ingresos.  Ella es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad y su meta de negocio es continuar mejorándole la imagen al local.
texts.en:
Martha is 68 years old. She comes from a family of retailers. When she was eight she lived with her aunt and asked her to teach her how to make pies to sell in the town square on Sundays. When she got married, she and her spouse moved to the city of Barranquilla and, in order to supplement her income, her brother-in-law proposed they sell underwear and pajamas. Even then she also prepared food at home to sell. After finishing school, she took sewing and baking courses. She only sewed for her children, but she kept her food business going. Currently she owns a restaurant where she serves delicious dishes. Every day from 5:00 am to 10:00 am she prepares her meals, breakfasts and lunches. 

Martha is requesting a Kiva loan. This is her first time applying for financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in purchasing a freezer and improving the image of her restaurant by replacing the flooring. By improving her business' appearance, this loan will allow her to appeal to more customers and in turn make more income. She is a mother of four adult children and her goal for her business is to continue improving her restaurant's appearance.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and replace the floor in her restaurant.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is the responsible mother of two children and they live in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 18 years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance of his taxi because the current condition of his vehicle is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do the maintenance on his taxi. 

Therefore Zahida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Zahida's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Zahida also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Zahida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to provide funds for the repair of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is 48 years old from Baniswef. She is married and has four children. She started a grocery store project to help her husband with the family income and guarantee a proper education for her children. 

Manal requested a 5,000 EGP loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on due dates. Now, Manal wishes to expand her project, so she has requested another 10,000 EGP loan to buy a refrigerator, fizzy drinks, and grocery products to increase her sales and her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, fizzy drinks, and grocery products.

loans.name: Las Manzanas Xepol Group

texts.en:
Friendship Bridge, with its unique Microcredit Plus Program combining small loans and education, provides a hand up to thousands of women in Guatemala. The additional household income gives clients a greater ability to weather unexpected life problems (illness or natural disaster), and decreases malnutrition, while improving access to education for the family, as well as improving hygiene and healthcare.

The Trust Bank “Manzanas de Xepol” in Chichicastenango is requesting their very first loan from Kiva investors. There are eight women in the group who range in age from 24 to 57 years. They hold fast to their cultural traditions, with one of them being their elaborate and beautiful outfits or “traje”.

The President of the Trust Bank is 26-year-old Maria, who is married with four children. She has a traditional textile business and creates colorful blouses or “huipiles” as well as “fajas” or belts. Both enjoy high demand in the area, and so Maria sells at the retail and wholesale level. She is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase good quality thread and other supplies for her work. Maria wants to offer her customers well-made, durable and pretty items.

As most of the women have had little or no education, they are anxious to learn from a Facilitator at their monthly meetings. Educational themes discussed range from hygiene, nutrition and health, to how to effectively run a business (budgeting, pricing, accounting, customer service). 

Gratitude to all Kiva investors for their compassion and kindness in funding these essential loans.

loans.use: to purchase good quality thread and other supplies for her textile business.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: María de 63 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive en saca de su propiedad junto a sus 3 hijos de 39, 38 y 30 años de edad, además vive con ellos un nieto. María es admirada por sus vecinos y amigos por su tenacidad para afrontar la vida, ya que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola como madre soltera, actualmente ella se gana la vida cultivando la tierra, además sus hijos le apoyan con los gastos de su hogar. María construyo el cuarto de la cocina y encemento la entrada de su vivienda con un crédito que solicito anteriormente, y debido a la buena experiencia ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: un portón, ventanas, cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para instalar el portón y ventanas en su vivienda y de esta manera brindar una mayor protección a su familia ya que la zona cada día es más peligrosa.
texts.en:
María, 63, is a hardworking woman who lives in her own house with her three children, aged 39, 38 and 30, as well as a grandchild. María is admired by her neighbours and friends for her tenacity in facing life, as she has managed to provide for her children on her own, as a single mother. She currently makes a living working the land, and her children also support her with household expenses.
María built the kitchen and cemented the entrance of her home with a loan that she previously requested, and because of the good experience has decided to request a new loan from FUSAI to invest in: a gate, windows, cement, sand, gravel and bricks to install the gate and windows in her home. In this way, she can provide better protection to her family, as their area is more dangerous every day.

loans.use: to invest in a gate and windows, and cement, sand, gravel and bricks to install the gate and windows in her home.

loans.name: Santos Angelica

texts.es:
La joven Santos es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos y  churros, desde hace 6 años.
Santos necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para como churros, refrescos y seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes.
Santos espera que gracias a esta inversión pueda mejorar un poco su calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar, espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hermanos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Abril del  2015
texts.en:
Young Santos is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives in a community in southern Honduras with her family.  Her business has been selling soft drinks and churros for six years.  

Santos needs this loan to buy more products, such as churros and soft drinks, and to keep doing her work, which makes up a part of her income.  She hopes this loan will increase her sales and be very helpful to her as she does not have the products she needs to cover her customers' demands.  

Santos hopes that, thanks to this investment, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life a little with the increase in household income; she hopes in the short term to make her business grow and thereby keep supporting her family and get her siblings the education they need so they can have better opportunities in life.  

Choluteca, Honduras – April,  2015

loans.use: to buy churros and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Restauración Del Valle Group

texts.es:
¨Restauración del valle¨, es un grupo mixto conformado por dos mujeres y un hombre. Ellos solicitan crédito  a ADIM, para invertirlos en sus negocios y seguir aportando a los pagos de los gastos del hogar. Doña Mirna, es la coordinadora del grupo, ella tiene 39 años , es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de edades de 19, 10 y 5 años. Se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante en su comunidad. Del préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de aguacate, papaya, melón y plátano. Con el crédito anterior logro invertir en una pulperia. 
Las demás integrantes son Maria Auxiliadora de 26 años quien elabora artesanías de madera desde hace 2 años en el mercado de Masaya, e invertirá en la compra de madera de guapinol. Yeffry de 21 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de nacatamales y destace de cerdo requiere del préstamo para la compra de 2 cerdos.
texts.en:
"Restauración del valle" is a mixed group made up of two women and a man. They ask ADIM for a loan to invest in their businesses and continue supporting the household expenses. Mirna is the coordinator of the group. She is 39 years old, single, and has 3 children, ages 19, 10, and 5. She works selling fruits and vegetables as a street vendor in her community. With the loan she will invest in the purchase of avocados, papayas, melons, and plantains. With the previous loan she managed to invest in a convenience store.

The other members are Maria Auxiliadora, 26 years old, who has made wooden crafts for the past 2 years, in the Masaya market, and will invest in guapinol wood. Yeffry is 21 years old and works preparing and selling Nicaraguan tamales and butchers pigs, he needs the loan to purchase 2 pigs.

loans.use: to purchase avocados, papayas, melons and plantains.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chargers, holsters, and controls

loans.name: Silivesiti

texts.en: Silivesiti, living in Kamwenge, Uganda, used his previous loan to rehabilitate his coffee plantation. He is a farmer who also buys and sells produce to earn extra income. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. He faces challenges of pests and diseases attacking his crops and soil exhaustion. His intention is transforming his business into commercial farming, so that he can get more profits and construct a good house. He is requesting a loan to buy coffee to supplement his harvests to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to supplement his harvests to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah, in Kamwenge, Uganda, used her previous loan to buy second-hand clothing to sell. She still sells second-hand clothing, and with the proceeds she has been able to raise money to support her family and also venture into banana selling since the latter business is seasonal.  She also rears goats to increase her income.Currently, inadequate capital and price fluctuation are her major set backs while her dream is to own a modern boutique, educate her children, and buy a business vehicle for easy access to different markets.  Dinah is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing to sell for women, men, and children.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell to women, men, and children.

loans.name: Estela Raquel

texts.es:
Estela, de 22 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor y también se dedica al oficio de la albañilería, tienen una hija de 4 años de edad.

Estela, se dedica en los oficios domésticos, también apoya a su pareja en los cultivos agrícolas, para permitirle a él que pueda trabajar, para poder llevar el sustento hasta su hogar pues él también trabaja en la construcción.

Estela, necesita el crédito para arreglar el techo de su casa, ya que se acerca el invierno y el techo está dañado y tiene muchas goteras y la madera ya no sirve, con la ayuda del préstamo logrará darle mayor seguridad a su familia.

Estela, quiere poder darle la educación necesaria a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Estela is 22 years old, she is partnered, her partner is a farmer and also works as a bricklayer. They have a 4-year-old daughter.

Estela takes care of the household tasks and also supports her partner with the agricultural crops, to allow him to be able to work, to be able to bring sustenance to the home since he also works in construction.

Estela needs the loan to fix the roof on her house, since winter is approaching and the roof is damaged and has many leaks and the wood is no longer good. With the help of the loan, she will manage to provide better security for her family. 

Estela wants to be able to provide the necessary education for her little daughter.

loans.use: to fix the roof on her house.

loans.name: Aroe

texts.en:
Aroe is a makeup artist who has created a home studio. Her clients receive ‎everyday's waxing and cosmetic treatments, as well as special occasion makeup design. She has ‎recently introduced specialty scarves and wraps which she creates. Aroe has succeeded ‎in growing her business and now she wants to expand her home studio to accommodate new ‎customers. ‎

She asked for this loan to assist in purchasing a makeup chair, makeup stand, materials for ‎scarves; including beads and specialty threads, wax machine, hair styling supplies, and a ‎washing station.‎

Aroe has been growing her business with increased confidence. She wants to continue ‎to expand and bring her services to more women throughout her area.‎

loans.use: To purchase beauty and makeup salon equipment and supplies

loans.name: Hannan

texts.en:
Hannan never finished high school and was married young. At the age of 49, she ‎has five children, four already grown. While she was unable to finish school, Hannan ‎never stopped studying and working to improve her family. She took several training ‎courses in cosmetics and hair design. Hannan opened her business in 2010 and slowly ‎began building it up. As her clientele grew, she moved to a new central location, outside ‎of her home. Now Hannan is expanding her customer base again and needs to make ‎some renovations.‎

She needed this loan to assist with paying for renovations, lighting and electrical work to ‎add outlets.‎

Hannan also works as an elderly aid. She wants to continue to manage her business ‎strongly and see it grow. In the future Hannan plans to add lingerie and cosmetic sales to ‎her business.‎

loans.use: To assist with paying for renovations, lighting and electrical work to add outlets.‎

loans.name: Geald

texts.en:
Gerald is a 41-year-old Ugandan. He is widowed and has three children aged 10, 7, and 5 years old. Two of his children attend school and he is their sole caretaker.

Gerald's main business is selling motorcycle spare parts. In addition, he also does farming to supplement his income.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to restock his spare part inventory. His business has steady stream of customers because of the many motorcycle owners and riders within the area. Motorcycle is the area's main means of transportation. 

Gerald dreams to expand his business in the future and to educate all his children.
He describes himself as and strives to continue to be a hardworking and honest person in business.

loans.use: To restock his motorcycle spare parts business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 12 y 8 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Juana con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típicas, ella desde hace diez años realiza esta labor.
Juana ahora necesita de un poco más de capital para poder comprar hilos de tipo seda, alemán y lustrina para tener sus materiales y seguir elaborando sus trajes típicos, por tal razón solicito un préstamo.
El gran sueño de Juana es contar con un local donde ella pueda exhibir mejor su producto y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and has a nice family of three children between the ages of 8 and 12 years.  This humble family lives in a community of Chichicastenango.  

Eager to generate income and provide for her family, Juana has made a living making traditional clothing.  She has been doing this job for 10 years.  

Juana now needs a little more capital to be able to buy silk, German, and cotton embroidery threads, in order to have her materials and continue making her traditional clothing.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan.  

Juana's great dream is to have a place where she can better showcase her product and improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy silk, German, and cotton embroidery threads.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: El grupo “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA” está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Joel tiene 25 de edad es soltero. El se dedica a la venta de pantalones palores  de todas las tallas hace un año. Y a la vez trabaja en una fábrica como operario de producción. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de pantalones al por mayor. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Joel es el primero del lado derecho viste pantalón negro
texts.en: The “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA” group is made up of members who work in retail trade. Joel is 25 years old and single. He has worked selling all sizes of fleece pants for a year. He also works in a factory as a production worker. He will invest the loan in the purchase of pants in bulk. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the offered loan. Joel is the first on the right who is wearing black pants.

loans.use: to purchase more fleece pants.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saum is in her early 30s. She is married and has three children who are still at school. She has been running a general store for four years now. She works from 5AM to 10PM daily and is able to make a good monthly income.
  
This will be Saum’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on her mama lishe business (open air vendor) and started a shop. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for all the support. She had used the profit from her shop pay for school fees, payback her loan repayment, buy a plot of land, and cover household expenses.
With this loan, she will use it to increase her inventory and restock the out-of-stock items in her mama lishe shop.

Saum dreams of building her own house. She will make sure she pays back the loan in accordance with the loan schedule.

loans.use: purchase inventory and restock the out-of-stock items in her mama lishe shop

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is married with five adult-age children, residing at Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services. Recently, she has accessed her new loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities and food products that she sells in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities and food products to sell

loans.name: Glory Be To God Group

texts.en: Hannah is 45 years old and a member and group representative of Glory Be to God group. Hannah and her group have been with the field partner since 2011. They were on-time with the repayments of their previous 10 loan cycles. Hannah is a married woman with 3 children. The ages of her children are 16, and the twins are 20 years old.  One of the children is in school currently. Hannah comes from Assin Fosu in the Assin North District in the Central Region of Ghana. Hannah is a caterer with 20 years of work experience. She makes meat pies, fried chips, fried rice, jollof rice, etc. With her 20 years of experience, business has been progressing year after year. Hannah has 15 apprentices. Hannah wants to expand her business in the future by acquiring equipment like a gas oven and other equipment which will help reduce order processing times for her customers to increase sales. Currently, Hannah needs micro loan support to buy flour, oil, margarine, and rice to be able to process her customer's orders on time. Her financial gain will be used to cater for the welfare of her family and business expansion. Hannah thanks all her micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, margarine, and rice for catering.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama is 39 years old, and from Baniswef. He is married and has two children. He wishes he could start a fattening project in a place prepared to get ready for the project. Salama's wife will join him in the project as she will use the milk from the cattle to make cheese and butter for domestic use and for sale in the market and their neighbors. Salama has requested 15 000 EGP to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 41 years old and a single mother, but both of her sons are independent. She lives with her mother and owns a food stall were she sells Mexican food. The business has a great location, because its in an avenue very close to a public school. Nancy says that her business is very well positioned in that neighborhood and has many recurring clients. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in her business to buy some food and condiments that she requires cooking her specialty, a Mexican soup called birria. Nancy says that she feels accomplished for providing support and helping her children become independent.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her food stall.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 28 years old and makes a living selling potatoes. She goes to many market fairs. She is single and lives with her parents 

Miriam needs a loan to buy more potatoes so that she is able to visit more market fairs and even travel to other places in the country to sell the potatoes.

She asks your support on this loan so that she can improve her business and provide for her parents who are senior citizens and not working anymore.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 46 years old and lives in Dapitan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married with three school-age children. Arlene works as one of the maintenance janitors in a subdivision. She is also farmer and wants to start raising pigs for additional earnings. Arlene joined Paglaum MPC so she could obtain financial assistance for business start ups. Recently, she requested a loan to buy two piglets, feed, and animal vitamins to start the business. In the future, she wants to raise more healthy pigs to earn more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy two piglets, feed, and animal vitamins to start the business.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean, single, is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for two years and earns a good income to help support her parents for the basic needs of their family. Mary Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and develop her skills in business engagements. 

She has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. The previous loan was used for personal purposes. Now, Mary Jean is requesting her 4th loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more inventories to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy more inventories to sell in her store.

loans.name: Amanecer Zona 1 Group

texts.en:
The Department of Quiche, in Western Highlands of Guatemala, has a diverse and beautiful landscape including fertile valleys planted with beans, corn, and potatoes. It is the cultural seat of the “Quiche” descendents of the Maya. Here, eight women have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Amanecer Zona 1” who works hard to meet the needs of their families, including education for their children.

One of the newer members in the Trust Bank is 32-year-old Virginia, who has been a preschool teacher. She has witnessed the positive changes that her friends in the Trust Bank have made and is excited to secure a loan. Virginia is motivated to help her husband meet the economic needs of the family and raise their standard of living. Currently, she owns a beauty salon and also sells new and used clothing. She runs the business out of her home. With her loan, Virginia plans to buy beauty products and increase her inventory of clothing. She shares that she is really pleased to be participating in the Trust Bank for the very first time, and polishing her business skills as a small-business woman. One of her long-range goals is to find a storefront and move the business out of her home.

Each month, Virginia and her friends in the Trust Bank meet to transact business on their loans. Also in attendance is a Friendship Bridge Facilitator who shares useful information with the women about the world around them and within them. At a recent educational training, the ladies learned how to identify and realize their goals and dreams. At other meetings, they might learn about effective business practices, health, hygiene, and nutrition, and the use of medicinal plants. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and small loans “Microcredit Plus” and it is very effective.

Kiva investors are much-appreciated partners with Friendship Bridge for these women. We look forward to providing a follow-up report in the near future! Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy beauty products and increase her inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia started her small time business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she made good sales since she is the only store in their neighborhood. Recently she approached Paglaum for much needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.en:
The beautiful Lake Atitlan in Guatemala is surrounded by picturesque mountains and volcanos. In the southwestern part of the lake is San Juan La Laguna and high in the mountains above the town is the small village of Palestina. Ten hard working ladies with small businesses make up the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esmeralda” in Palestina. They are happy that their businesses are helping their families and improve the quality of their lives. 

Twenty-eight year old Gemima is a successful businesswoman who has been supported by microloans from Friendship Bridge and KIVA investors. She and her family make pants. At this time, she is requesting a new loan to buy a larger variety and quantity of fabrics to make pants that more customers will want to purchase. She wants to be sure to have plenty of inventory available at all times.

The entire Trust Bank “Esmeralda” is requesting a loan to increase their inventories of products and raw materials. They know that new investment loans will grow their businesses. The ladies mentioned they also are grateful for the very beneficial “Microcredit Plus” educational program. Each month they learn about important topics that they can use in their daily lives including health, hygiene, and business management tools. One recent topic they highlighted was learning how to assert their rights as women. 

They thank the KIVA investors for supporting the Friendship Trusts Bank which help the ladies to fulfill their dreams, provide for their families, and develop the community into a better place to live for all!

loans.use: To buy a larger variety and quantity of fabrics to make pants that more customers desire

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
