Yamileth, se dedica a vender productos como cosméticos y otros productos para el sexo femenino desde hace algunos años, fue una amiga quien la motivo a que se escribiera a cierta empresa como promotora de una marca de cosméticos, regularmente ella viaja una distancia de 2 kilómetros, para ofrecer a sus clientes los productos que ella vende a través de catálogos.

El préstamo que Yamileth, está solicitando es para mejorar su vivienda, ya que le hará unos arreglos a una habitación para mejor comodidad, específicamente cambiará el techo y un par de puertas y que es necesario sustituirlas para mayor seguridad.
 
El sueño de Yamileth, es brindar a sus cuatro hijos una vivienda digna, cómoda y segura para vivir.
texts.en:
Yamileth, who is 32 years of age, completed secondary school and opted for the Administrative Assistant stream. Her life partner, with whom she has 4 children, currently lives in USA.  Yamileth receives help from the father of her children, but she sells cosmetics and other products by catalog in order to cover certain household expenses.

Yamileth has been selling products such as cosmetics and other products for women for a number of years. A friend of hers suggested she write to a certain company as a promoter for a brand of cosmetics. She regularly travels a distance of 2 kilometres in order to offer her clients the products that she sells via catalogues. 

The loan that Yamileth is requesting is to improve her housing, as it will be used to do some repairs on one of the rooms so that it is more comfortable. Specifically, she will replace the roof and a couple of doors because they need to be replaced for better security. 
 
Yamileth's dream is to give her four children a decent, comfortable and safe home to live in.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Nhóm 01-Phố Phú Thọ 3-P.phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tám operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

Tám is 54 years old and she is married with two children. Tám is the group leader of the Nhóm 01-Phố Phú Thọ 3-P.Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Tám joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Tám has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Tám has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Tám faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tám hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.pt:
O sr Bonifacio tem 34 anos de idade, casado e pai de 03 filhos dos quais 02 frequentam o ensino primário e 01ainda não tem idade escolar.
É funcionário de uma empresa vocacionada na construçao de sombras e pintura. Ele trabalha como pintor e, com o empréstimo de 30.000,00mts, pretende comprar cimento, areia, pedra para fazer acabamentos da sua casa, já que o material até então comprado nao é suficiente para conclcuir a sua casa.
Este senhor sonha em concluir a sua casa para confortar a sua familia e o seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro do prazo acordado.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is 34 years old and married. He has three children, two of whom are in primary school and one is below school age.
He's an employee at a company that builds covers and does paintwork. He works as a painter. With the loan for 30,000mts he intends to purchase cement, sand and rocks so that he can finish his house, since the supplies he has bought so far aren't enough to do that.
This gentleman dreams of finishing his house in order to accomodate his family. His challenge is repaying the loan within the agreed-upon timeline.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and rocks so that he can finish his house.

loans.name: Denny Eduviges

texts.es:
Denny, es dueño de un taller de tabla roca e instalación de cielo falso; es casado su familia está formada por su esposa y cuatro hijos, dos aun dependen de él; su negocio lo desarrolla de manera independiente desde hace  10 años, trabaja con un horario de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, el negocio se lo enseño su familia, ya cuenta con mucha experiencia por lo que no representa dificultades en continuar trabajando, no tiene ayuda del extranjero.
Comprará tabla roca, aluminio, tornillos, aislantes, etc., para desarrollar su trabajo eficientemente y con mayor calidad, espera atraer nueva clientela, obtener mayores ventas por ende mejores ganancias.
Las aspiraciones de Denny son ampliar su negocio,  comprar una casa y tener los recursos económicos necesarios para pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Denny owns a workshop for drywall and dropped ceiling installation. He is married and has four children. Two of them are still dependent. He has been developing his business independently for 10 years. His working hours are 6 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. His family taught him the trade. He has so much experience now that he does not have difficulties to continue working. He does not have any foreign helper.

He will buy drywall, aluminum, screws, insulation etc.to carry out the work efficiently and with higher quality. He hopes to attract new customers, thereby obtaining higher sales and better earnings.

Denny's aspirations are to expand his business, buy a house, and have the financial resources for his children’s college education.

loans.use: to buy drywall, aluminum, screws, insulation etc.to carry out the work efficiently and with higher quality

loans.name: Elizabeth Filomena

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 42 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus hijos y sus padres en casa propia en una comunidad grande en el distrito de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y animales menores como patos y gallinas, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 3 años y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales y alimento balanceado para la crianza de los mismos, de esta manera ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y por ende poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and single. She lives with her children and her parents in their own house in a large community in the district of Cayalti, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

She works raising and selling pigs and small animals like chickens and ducks. She has done this business for more than 3 years and has good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the district. She is requesting this loan to buy a greater quantity of animals and balanced feed to raise them. In this way she hopes to expand her business more, obtain more income and in the end improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals and balanced feed to raise them.

loans.name: Jose Rene

texts.es:
José, fabrica toldos y lonas para protegerse del sol o la lluvia, vive con su familia, el oficio es algo que aprendió de sus padres, todos colaboran para poder cumplir con las demandas de sus productos y mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
Solicita un crédito para poder comprar telas, nailon, pegamento, tubos, etc., mejorara el inventario del negocio, lo cual le permitirá entregar sus pedidos con anticipación y atraer nuevos clientes, espera que las ventas se mantengan y sus ingresos aumente.
José sueña con tener los recursos económicos necesarios para cancelar su deuda y hacer reparaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jose manufactures canopies and awnings for sun or rain protection. He lives with his family and this job is something that he learned from his parents. All of them work together in order to meet the demand for their products and to keep their customers happy.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, nylon, glue, tubes, etc., to improve his business' stock, which will enable him to deliver his orders in advance and attract new customers. He expects that sales will continue and his income will increase.

Joseph dreams of having the necessary financial resources to pay off his debt and to make repairs to his home.

loans.use: He is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, nylon, glue, tubes, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
This is Emmanuel, 23, and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is single and has a transportation business to help his parents provide for their family's needs.

Emmanuel has operated a tricycle for five years already. His tricycle carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Silang, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and busses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, church, to their friend’s homes and to other destinations within their community. They even transport from one town to the other. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 a day. 

To help him continue his transport business, Emmanuel is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to pay for his tricycle maintenance. It is important that his unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service and steady income. He is positive that this will boost his income as tricycle transportation is really a necessity in their place. 

Emmanuel wishes to have other types of business to improve his income. He prays for God's travelling mercies in all his trips and prosperity in all his endeavours. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for his tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Jose Ines

texts.es:
José, de 34 años de edad, estudio solo primer grado, creció con sus abuelos, pues sus padres murieron cuando estaba pequeño, se casó hace 6 años, su esposa de dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene 3 hijos, una de ellas está estudiando en el kínder.

José, trabaja en la siembra de hortalizas como pepino, ejote, tomate, entre otros, oficio que le enseño un amigo con quien él trabajaba, luego decidió trabajar individual; también trabaja en la albañilería todos los días desde muy temprano, pues necesita tener los ingresos económicos suficientes para sostener su familia. 

José, está solicitando un crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes para sembrar dos hortalizas, esto le ayudará para poder seguir trabajando.

José, sueña con poder seguir trabajando para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos a realizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
José is 34 years old, only completed the first grade and was raised by his grandparents, as his parents died when he was young. He got married 6 years ago and his wife makes a living in domestic work. They have 3 children, one of which is studying in Kindergarten.

José works in sowing vegetables such as cucumbers, green beans, tomatoes, among others, a job that was taught to him by a friend he used to work with. Later, he decided to work individually; he also works construction every day starting very early, as he needs to earn sufficient income to sustain his family.

José is requesting a loan to buy compost, pesticides and fertilizers to plant two vegetable gardens, this will help him be able to continue working. José dreams to be able to continue working to be able to improve the quality of life for his family, and support his children complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides and fertilizers to plant two vegetable gardens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, brick, gravel, sand, and iron to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Katherine Jazmin

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señorita Katherine, tiene 22 años de edad y es soltera, vive con sus padres.
Doña Katherine se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 5 años a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más mercadería como: camisetas, shorts, jeans y blusas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta por la organización, los intereses bajos y el buen trabajo del promotor. Su sueño es tener un título profesional y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Manta is considered the most important, popular and frequently visited resort in Ecuador, because of its beautiful and alluring beaches and the fact that is the primary deep water port of Ecuador and South America.

This is where Katherine lives. She is 22 years old and single, and she lives with her parents.

Doña Katherine sells children’s clothing door to door, and she also sells from her home, where she has a small shop. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. 

She allows her customers to buy on credit and she collects every fifteen days or monthly depending upon need. She has been doing this for five years and it is going very well. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as t-shirts, shorts, jeans and blouses. She has been in the credit group for 4 cycles and she likes the organization, the low interest rates and the loan officer’s good work. Her dream is to have a professional title, and to see her business grow.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, jeans and blouses.

loans.name: Katty Yadira

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Gema que se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Katty, tiene 43 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 24 y 14  años, el menor estudia en colegio y es el que  aun vive con ella. 
Doña Katty es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, esto mucho mas después de la muerte de su marido el cual era la fuente de ingresos de su hogar y que al no estar el  ella tuvo que afrontar con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende pescado por libras, ciertos granos así como también aguas, colas, entre otras bebidas, allí trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos cuando ellos pueden pero realmente es ella la que siempre está atenta a las necesidades de sus clientes. Lleva 6 años en este negocio el cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario para ella y sus hijos. 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, aguas, granos,  colas y todo de lo que ella vende en su local. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan a financiar su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The "Santa Gema" communal bank meets every 15 days in the Tarqui neighborhood of the city of Manta, This city is known for it's beautiful beaches and has many visitors all year long and as a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Katty lives in this place. She is 43 years old and her husband is dead. From this relationship she has two children aged 24 and 14 years old. The youngest studies in Secondary school so he still lives with her. Katty is a woman who has had to work very hard to raise her children and even more so after the death of her husband who was the source of income for the household.Since he was no longer there she had to face paying the household expenses and education of her children.

So she works in business. She has a shop in her house where she sells fish by weight, some grains as well as water, colas amongst other drinks. She works here every day with the help of her children when they can. But really it is her who is always attending to the needs of her clients. She has been in this business for 6 years which allows her to make the daily sustenance for her and her children.

She will use the loan to buy fish, water, grains, colas and everything she sells in her store. She has been in the communal bank for 4 years and she likes it as the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy fish, water, grains, colas, etc.

loans.name: Saly's Group

texts.fr: Saly qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, premiere femme debout, est membre d’un groupe de 15 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sola au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Saly, âgée de 52 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 2 à 18 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Saly à exercer cette activité. Saly cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Saly entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement, des semences et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Saly effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Saly cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Saly planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre sa surface cultivée . Enfin Saly espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille
texts.en:
Saly, the woman standing first from the left in the first row in the photo, is a member of a group of fifteen farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Sola, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 52 years old and the mother of six children, aged 2 to 18, of whom one is currently in school.  

Saly is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she has been encouraged to do this work. She cultivates peanuts, rice, and a market garden on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain, farm equipment, and quality fertilizers.

Saly is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system, the seeds, and the quality fertilizer. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her 0.0625-hectare parcel of land. 

Saly has been growing peanuts for their value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as a sauce base in cooking. Peanuts also have commercial value, since they are a food she sells on the market.

With greater yields and higher income, Saly is planning on raising livestock and expanding her arable land. Ultimately, she hopes also to cover her children’s schooling costs, as well as to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts for increasing her plot’s productivity

loans.name: Jose Henry

texts.es:
José, es propietario de una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y práctica la crianza de cerdos; es casado y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, atiendo a tiempo completo su negocio para tener una fuente de ingresos permanente, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero. 
Invertirá en alimento para los cerdos y surtirá la tienda con granos básicos, bebidas, detergentes, jabón, boquitas, etc., para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas y tener mejor liquidez. 
Sus sueños son tener un estilo de vida más confortable y darle a su hijo educación para que pueda tener un mejor desarrollo en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Jose owns a shop selling basic and practical needs for pig breeding. He is married and has a 5 year old son. He attends to his business full time for a permanent source of income. He does not have any outside financial aid.

He will invest in pig feed and stock his store with basic grains, beverages, detergents, soap, snacks etc., to meet the customer demand, increase sales, and have better liquidity.

Jose’s dreams are to have more comfortable life style and provide education for his child so he can grow in society.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and stock his store with basic grains, beverages, detergents, soap, snacks etc., to meet the customer demands

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 1 Hoa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Lan is 44 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 01 Thôn 1 Hoa Lộc solidarity group. 

This is Lan's first loan with the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes her family will be healthy and happy, to buy a motorbike and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 29 Thắng Tây Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương has a service business providing game services. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to maintain her game service shop.

Hương is 20 years old, and she is married with one child. Hương is the group leader of the Nhóm 29 Thắng Tây Ngư Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hương has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to maintain her game service shop

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Salvacion is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Salvacion has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a 4,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Salvacion has been in this business for two years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 49 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, home care products and other groceries. She has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, beverages, home-care products and other groceries

loans.name: Diara's Group

texts.fr: Diara qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à droite, portant un foulard blanc  , est membre d’un groupe de 28 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tonfa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Diara, âgée de 55 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 20 à 32 ans. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Diara à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Diara cultive l'arachide, le mais, le riz  sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et de terres cultivables. Diara entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Diara effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Diara cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Diara planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Diara espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Diara, appearing in the second row in the photo and wearing a white scarf, is a member of a group of 28 farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Tonfa, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 55 years old and the mother of five children, aged 20 to 32.  

Diara is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she has been encouraged to do this work for 30 years now. She cultivates peanuts, corn, and rice on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain, farm equipment, and arable land.

Diara is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system, the seeds, and the quality fertilizer. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her 0.0625-hectare parcel of land. 

Diara has been growing peanuts for 20 years for their value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as a sauce base in cooking. Peanuts also have commercial value, since they are a food she sells on the market.

With greater yields and higher income, Diara is planning on raising livestock. Ultimately, she hopes also to cover her children’s schooling costs, as well as to ensure her family’s self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to obtain a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Phố Hạnh Phúc, Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng  has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more machines to do the tailoring services.

Hồng  is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Hồng  is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 phố Hạnh Phúc, Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Hồng  has been involved in this business for 7 years.
The main hardship that Hồng  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng  hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: purchase more machines to do the tailoring services

loans.name: Rosario Robertina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Gema que se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 68 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una hija la cual ya es  mayor de  edad e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Rosario y su esposo se dedican al comercio, tienen una tienda víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas, carnes, artículos de bazar y papelería, entre otras cosas,  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, actualmente necesita el crédito para invertir principalmente en útiles escolares ya que es lo que más se vende en esta época del año y esperan aprovechar la oportunidad de obtener mejores ingresos, tienen más de 30 años con este negocio el cual les ha permitido seguir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar útiles escolares y víveres. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que les ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su tienda y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Santa Gema credit group meets every 15 days in the Tarqui neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is well known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round, and for being a city of unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions. 

This is where señora Rosario lives. She is 68 years old and married. She has a daughter from this union who is grown and on her own. Her husband is a businessman.

Doña Rosario and her husband are business people. They have a general store in their home. They sell all kinds of products there, such as rice, sugar, oils, detergent, legumes, vegetables and fruits, meats, and household items and stationery among other things. They work every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes later.

Now she needs the loan to invest primarily in school supplies, since that is what is sold most at this time of year. They hope to take advantage of the opportunity to earn a better income. They have had this business for more than 30 years, which has allowed them to continue progressing.

The loan will be used to add more selection to the store. She will buy school supplies and general provisions. She has been with the credit group from the start, and she likes the services that the institution offers her. 

Her dreams are to continue improving her store and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and general provisions.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a 51-year-old married woman with eight children.  Her youngest child is 13. Her husband is a fisherman. She is engaged in the buying and selling of seaweed. She sells seaweed to the locals where she lives. She has been engaged in this kind of business for almost ten years now.  

She  is asking for a loan to purchase additional stocks of seaweed. This will provide her with an abundant supply to cater to her customers' needs. Consequently, her income will improve and she will be able to repay her obligations. She will also be able to meet the needs of her growing children, including providing them with a quality education.

Virgilia hopes that her seaweed business will be productive and successful in the coming years.

loans.use: to  purchase additional stocks of seaweed

loans.name: Cruz Betty

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Gema que se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de  edad e independientes. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña Cruz es una mujer que le gusta conseguir sus propios recursos y esto a base de trabajo, ella  se dedica al comercio, tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende colas, aguas, jugos, helados, entre otras bebidas, ella  también se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, interiores, etc. Ella sale a ofrecer sus productos puerta a puerta y también vende en su local cuando sus clientes así lo desean, actualmente lo que más está vendiendo es ropa interior para niños por la entrada a clases de los chicos, ella deja a crédito  y cobra cada ocho días. Este negocio ella lo comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación y con los que hacen posible los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa interior, sabanas y toda clase de bebidas. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su vida cada vez mas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Santa Gema” meets fortnightly in Tarqui, a neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is famous for its beautiful beaches, popular all year long. Its beauty has no equal and it has many touristic attractions. This is where Cruz lives. She is 58, married, and has two children who are independent adults. Her husband is a cabinetmaker. 

Cruz is a woman who likes to work to generate her own income. She is a saleswoman and has a small store at home where she sells sodas, water, juices, ice cream and different beverages. She also sells clothes, sheets and underwear, among other things. She sells door-to-door, but also at home when her customers want to shop there.  At this time, what is selling the most is children's underwear that she sells at the entrance to a boy's school. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days.  She started this business with the first loan that she received in the group, and she is very grateful to the Fundacion and to those who make these loans possible.

Cruz will use this loan to buy underwear, sheets, and all types of beverages.  She is the founder of the communal bank, and she likes it because this is how she started her business.  Her dream is to continue forward and continuously improve her life.

loans.use: to buy underwear, sheets, and beverages

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Esther has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing nets.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Tulganoi

texts.en: Tulganoi is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1957. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has one son. She is a hardworking, responsible, careful and honest person. She is the first women to open a collective farm in her area. She has one hectare of land where she plants carrots, potatoes, wheat and other agricultural products. She herself controls and owns this activity. Her son also helps his mother to do business. Her husband is a carpenter. She wants to get a good harvest in the coming season and plans to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals to process her land. She is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and natural chemicals to process her land

loans.name: Sayi

texts.en: Sayi, 24, is originally from Kampong Chhnang Province. She is the mother of one little child. To make a living, she works in a private factory and earns, on average, USD 10.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for five years. She resides a little bit far from a water source so it is hard and time consuming for her to get water. For this reason, she is applying for a KIVA loan to dig a well for household use. With the support of this loan, she hopes that she can get water to use more easily and spent a shorter time doing this than before. She is thankful to the lenders for their financial support towards poor people.

loans.use: to dig a well

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 53, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ireneo, a tricycle driver, and she has children who are already married. She and her husband work hard to meet their daily needs.

Evelyn has operated a tricycle business for five years. Her husband drives the tricycle, which carries up to four passengers. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Silang, the tricycle is a common means of transportation. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 a day.

Jeepneys and buses are limited and very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to the market, church, their friend’s homes, and to other destinations within their community. They even ride them from one town to the other. 

To help in operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan which she will use for maintenance of her tricycle. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation is a great need. She is thanking God, and you, in advance for the financial help that will surely cover their daily sustenance.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to buy another tricycle to improve her income. She prays that God will prosper their lives and that they will enjoy good health and a long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle maintenance.

loans.name: Verónica Cesarina

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3 hijos de 27, 22 y 15 años que estudian los dos mayores en la Universidad y uno en el colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Verónica tiene una tienda comercial de consumo masivo (arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, leches, etc.)Trabaja de Lunes a  Sábados desde las 7h00 hasta las 14h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos trabajan con ella en el negocio,  por lo general es ella la que más pasa en su negocio ya que es ahí donde le gusta estar ya que además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se informa de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene dos años con esta actividad familiar y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar aceite, manteca en diferentes presentaciones, shampoo, esponjas, pilas, etc. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 2 ciclos y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo y son cumplidas con los pagos. Su sueño es seguir ayudando a sus hijos y que el negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Manta, Ecuador is considered as the most important, popular, and well-visited resort in Ecuador for its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It is also the first deep water port in Ecuador and South America.

This is where Veronica is from. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children at ages 27, 22 and 15. Two of the older children study in a university and the youngest is in high school. Her husband is a merchant.

Veronica has a retail store for bulk products (rice, sugar, oils, detergents, milk, etc.). She works from Monday to Saturday from 7am until 2pm and sometimes even later. Her children work with her although she is usually at the store because she likes to be there and be entertained and informed of her neighborhood. It has been two years in this business and it is doing very well.

The loan will be use to stock her store. She will buy oil, butter in various packages, shampoo, sponges, batteries, etc. It is her 2nd loan through Grupo De Credito (Group Credit ). She likes it because she has more friends in the group and she met her payments. Her dream is to continue helping her children and grow the business.

loans.use: to buy oil, butter, shampoo, sponges, batteries etc.

loans.name: Glady Mae

texts.en:
Glady Mae is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 23 years old and has one child who is in school.

Glady Mae has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fish to sell.

Glady Mae has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice. Lucy is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stock of ingredients for her food vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rona Marie

texts.en:
Rona Marie works hard to support her family. Rona Marie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bundle of fishing net.

Rona Marie has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Rona Marie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 50 years old and has six children.  Nelia is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds for her pigs.

Nelia has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Yadie's Group

texts.fr: Yadie qui se trouve sur la photo tenant deux pochettes, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tabacoro-Tian au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Yadie, âgée de 47 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 2 à 27 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille a incité Yadie à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Yadie cultive l'arachide, le gombo, le sésame sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériel agricoles. Yadie entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité. Cette année Yadie effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Yadie cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Yadie planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu de faire de l'élevage et d'étendre la surface cultivée. Enfin Yadie espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille. Elle a exprimé que, "l'avantages de l'agriculture sont incalculables."
texts.en:
Yadie, appearing in the photo and holding two pouches, is a member of a group of 11 farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Tabacoro-Tian, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 47 years old and the mother of four children, aged 2 to 27 years old, of whom none is currently in school.

Yadie has been encouraged to work in farming for 30 years, since it enables her to ensure her family’s self-sufficiency in food. She grows peanuts, okra, and sesame on her parcel of land. But as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as a lack of rain and farm equipment.

Yadie is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the quality seeds. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase yields on her 0.125-hectare parcel of land. 

For 30 years, Yadie has been growing peanuts for their value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are used as a sauce base in cooking. Peanuts also have commercial value, since they are a food she sells on the market.

With greater yields and higher income, Yadie is planning on raising livestock and expanding her arable land. Ultimately, she also hopes to ensure the family’s self-sufficiency in food. “The advantages of farming are incalculable,” she said.

loans.use: to obtain a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira is a kind woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an engineer. She studied in high school with excellence. After graduation from high school, she got married and moved to her village. Their standard of living is hard and Zamira is used to working in order to feed their family and live. For almost ten years she has had a business of keeping and selling livestock. She appealed to IMON asking for help for the treatment of her child. Her child is sick and she wants to receive treatment in a medical clinic. She awaits KIVA lenders' kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to treat her child in medical clinic

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store business.

Virginia has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like a net, bamboo, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like a net, bamboo, gasoline, etc

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz, age 48, is a mother of two sons and one daughter. Her son owns a tailoring shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring material for the shop, including thread, needles, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money he finds this difficult. Therefore, his mother, Shehnaz, is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her son. He will purchase the needed things with the help of the loan amount. Shehnaz is feeling happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of tailoring material for her son's tailoring shop

loans.name: Teodulfa

texts.en:
Teodulfa engages in the raising and selling of hogs. She is a 26-year-old married woman with two young dependents, ages 3 and 5 years old. Together with her family, she lives in Getafe, Bohol. She needs capital to be able to continue her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy pigs and for additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. This loan will help Teodulfa enhance her livelihood by running a sari-sari (variety) store, and able to improve her hog raising business as well.

Teodulfa hopes that her business will be productive so that she is able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pigs and for additional capital for her general store.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney.

Elsie has been in this business for 6 years. Elsie earns more income from rice retailing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her jeepney

loans.name: Chata's Group

texts.fr: Chata qui se trouve sur la photo est assise au premier rang avec l'enfant, est membre d’un groupe de 6 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tonfa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Chata, âgée de 58 ans, est la mère de 12 enfants âgés de 19 à 39 ans, L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Chata à exercer cette activité. Chata cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Chata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Chata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Chata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Chata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et d'acheter du matériel agricole. Enfin Chata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants
texts.en:
Chata, sitting in the first row in the photo with her child, is a member of a group of 6 farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Tonfa, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 58 years old and the mother of 12 children, aged 19 to 39.  

Chata is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, she has been encouraged to do this work. She cultivates peanuts on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain, farm equipment, and quality fertilizer.

Chata is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system, the seeds, and the quality seeds, as well as the quality fertilizer. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her 0.0625-hectare parcel of land. 

Diara has been growing peanuts for their value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as a sauce base in cooking. Peanuts also have commercial value, since they are a food she sells on the market.

With greater yields and higher income, Chata is planning on raising livestock and buying farm equipment. Ultimately, she hopes also to cover her children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts for increasig her plot's productivity

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase women's and children's sandals for resale.

loans.name: Yacouba's Group

texts.fr: Yacouba qui se trouve sur la photo portant un boubou rouge et blanc est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tonfa au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Yacouba, âgé de 65 ans, est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 8 à 44 ans, dont 7 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Yacouba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Yacouba cultive le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Yacouba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Yacouba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 50 ans que Yacouba cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Yacouba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'étendre la surface cultivée et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Yacouba espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille
texts.en:
Yacouba, appearing in the photo and wearing a red and white boubou, is a member of a group of seven farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Tonfa, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. He is 65 years old and the father of seven children, aged 8 to 44, of whom seven are currently in school. 

Yacouba is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency at home. Thus, he has been encouraged to do this work for fifty years now. He grows corn on his parcel of land. But, as a farmer, he must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain, farm equipment, and quality fertilizer. 

Yacouba is beginning his first year with myAgro and signed up because of the payment system and the quality seeds, as well as the quality fertilizer. This year, he is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn, so as to increase his yields on his 0.5-hectare parcel of land. 

Yacouba has been growing corn for fifty years for its value as a staple food and for the productive and market advantages. With greater yields and higher income, he is planning on expanding his arable land and to work in commerce. Ultimately, he also hopes to cover his children’s schooling costs, as well as to ensure the family’s self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing corn for increasing his plot's productivity

loans.name: Nurahmad

texts.en:
Nurahmad is 49 years old, married and a good father of five children. Nurahmad lives with his wife, three sons and two daughters in the district of Hamadoni. One of his sons is a migrant worker in Russia. He wants to earn some money there, come home and enter university. Nurmahmad does not have such money. He has been engaged in agriculture since his childhood. Thus he provides for his family. 

At the moment, he has no money to buy seeds and fertilizers. For him, it is very important because if he will not plant a crop in this year, they will be left without food. For this reason, Nurahmad applied for a loan. Please help him to improve his life. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Oyotún, la cual es una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila y sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería como peón agrícola, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 1 año. Solicita préstamo para la compra de nuevas herramientas de trabajo así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales herramientas, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas lo que le permitirá brindar mejores servicios, incrementando su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustin is 58 years old.  He lives in a family house in the district of Oyotún, which is a rural region located in the Chiclayo province and Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.  Life in this district is quiet and its inhabitants are engaged in agriculture, trade, and animal breeding.  

For the last year, he has made a living as a farmhand day laborer.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of new work tools as well as to provide maintenance to his current tools.  This will help him to have his tools in better conditions which will allow him to provide better services.  This will increase his income level and ultimately improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase new work tools as well as to provide maintenance to his current tools.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles works hard to support her family. Angeles is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc.

Angeles has been in this business for eight years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Noumoutene's Group

texts.fr: Noumoutene qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, asseyant sur le banc a droite avec le drapeau de myAgro en main, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Zambouroula au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Noumoutene, âgée de 47 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 11 à 25 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. Elle a expliqué que, "si quelque chose a été bonne il y a une reprise." L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Noumoutene à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Elle a mentionné que, "l'entente est la meilleure des armes." Noumoutene cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériel agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Noumoutene entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Elle a exprimé que, "il faut pas faire les funérailles d'un criquet tant la paille n'a pas fini de brûler." Cette année Noumoutene effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 32 ans que Noumoutene cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Elle a expliqué que, "espérons la richesse sa facilite, l'épanouissement." Noumoutene planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et de pouvoir faire du commerce. Elle a mentionné que, "le chameau aimerait bien s’étaler mais son dos ne lui permet pas." Enfin Noumoutene espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Noumoutene, who is sitting on the right of the bench in the first rank of the photo, with the myAgro flag in hand, is a member of a group of 12 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Zambouroula, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

47-year-old Noumoutene is the mother of six children from 11 to 25 years of age, of whom four currently attend school. She explains that "when something good happens, it leads to recovery".

Family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, which prompted Noumoutene to practice this activity for over 30 years, to ensure her family's self-sufficiency.

She mentions that "understanding is the best weapon". Noumoutene cultivates groundnuts and rice on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain, agricultural equipment, and quality fertilizer.

Noumoutene is entering her first year with myAgro, and applied because of the payment system and the quality of seeds and fertilizer. She says "you should not celebrate the cricket's funeral while the straw is still burning".

This year Noumoutene is making payments to buy a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and increase the crop yield on her 0.125 hectare plot (0.31 acres).

For the past 20 years Noumoutene has been cultivating groundnuts for its food value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet, but also for its commercial value, since she sells groundnuts at the market. She explained that "hoping for prosperity fosters development".

With increasing crop yields and income, Noumoutene is planning to raise livestock and become a merchant. She mentioned that "the camel can't sprawl because of its back". Finally, she hopes to cover the children's school costs and build a family home.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, and benefit from training in agricultural techniques offered by myAgro

loans.name: Don Precieux (1) Group

texts.en:
Judith is a member of the community bank group Don Precieux (1) in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Helping to lead a group of seven other micro-entrepreneurs, Judith makes and sells manioc, a local cassava-based food staple in Congo. Judith also buys and sells used clothes. 

Judith is requesting her fourth loan with HOPE Congo and will use the loan to purchase the raw materials to prepare manioc as well as reinforcing her inventory of used clothes. Judith knows that the quality of her product matters to her clients, both for clothes and manioc. In the future, she dreams to improve the lives of her children and to assist them as a single mother of six children.

loans.use: to purchase flour and other materials to make manioc.

loans.name: Sebeke Group

texts.fr:
Awa est la femme qui a la tasse de l’arachide avec une daba à l’épaule.
Awa  est une femme malienne âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée à un cultivateur de sa localité. Awa  est mère de six (06) enfants âgés de 1an  à 27 ans parmi lesquels aucun n’est scolarisé.
Non alphabétisée ; elle fait la culture d’arachide pendant l’hivernage pour gagner sa vie et pour pouvoir supporter les charges de ses enfants. 
Awa  fait recourt au prêt du RMCR afin de pouvoir agrandir son surface cultivable et mieux entretenir son champ.
Avec le prêt du RMCR, elle achètera plus de semences d’arachide, de l’engrais et payera de la main d’œuvre aux charriés pour labourer son champ.
Son travail étant saisonnier, elle pourrait avoir  un bénéfice prévisionnel de 110 000 FCFA pour quelques mois.
texts.en:
Awa is the woman with a tub of peanuts and a daba [short-handled hoe] on her shoulder. She is a Malian woman, 41 years old, and married to a farm in her town. She is the mother of six children, aged 1 to 27, of whom none is in school.  An illiterate person, she grows peanuts during the rainy season in order to earn her living and to support her children. 

Awa has turned to a loan from RMCR for expanding her arable land and better maintaining her field. With this loan, she will purchase more peanut seeds and fertilizer and pay for the manual labor for plowing her field.  

Since her work is seasonal, she could obtain a projected profit of 100,000 francs CFA over a few months.

loans.use: to purchase peanut seeds and fertilizer and to pay for manual labor

loans.name: Don Precieux (2) Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a member of the community bank group Don Precieux (2) in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Helping to lead a group of eight other micro-entrepreneurs, Patrick sells onions, garlic, and other spices in bulk. With his second loan with HOPE Congo, Patrick will buy large sacks of onion and garlic, which he will then resell in smaller quantities. 

In order to keep the best clients, Patrick understands that he must select the highest quality products for his customers and also offer discounts when possible. Additionally, Patrick has recently added bananas to his offering of products. In the future, Patrick would love to expand further up the value chain to import his goods directly or perhaps one day start his own farm where he could grow his own produce with Congo’s fertile soil.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onion and garlic for resale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José vive en casa propia con su cónyuge, en una zona rural pertenciente al distrito Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en esta comunidad es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería principalmente.

José se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería como peón agrícola, realiza esta actividad desde hace 35 años, su servicio lo ofrece en su distrito y alrededores, solicita préstamo para la compra de palanas, machetes y otras herramientas para su negocio, de esta forma el espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que va a permitir que sus ingresos aumenten, sus ganancias mejoren y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su esposa también.
texts.en:
José lives in his own home with his partner in a rural area in the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coast.  Life in this community if peaceful and its inhabitants work primarily in farming, commerce, and ranching. 

José works as a laborer doing farm work; he has been doing this work for 35 years; he offers his services in his district and the surrounding areas; he is requesting this loan to buy shovels, machetes, and other tools for his business; in this way he hopes to offer his customers better service, which will allow him to increase his income and improve his earnings, along with his quality of life and that of his partner as well.

loans.use: to buy shovels, machetes, and other tools for his business

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.fr: Mariam qui se trouve au deuxième rang et qui montre la pochette myAgro est membre d’un groupe de 32 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Zantiebougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Mariam, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 18 à 30 ans.L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, ont incité Mariam à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Mariam cultive l'arachide, le mais sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Mariam entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité. Cette année Mariam effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Mariam cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Mariam planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Mariam espère aussi pouvoir financer le mariage de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mariam, who is in the second rank showing the myAgro packet, is a member of a group of 32 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro. They live and work in the village of Zantiebougou, to the south-east of Bamako, in Mali.

60-year-old Mariam is the mother of six children from 18 to 30 years of age. Family tradition is anchored in the practice of agriculture, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, which prompted Mariam to practice this activity for over 40 years.

Mariam cultivates groundnuts and maize on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of rain and agricultural equipment. She is entering her first year with myAgro, and applied because of the payment system and the quality of seeds.

This year Mariam is making payments to buy a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and increase the crop yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot (0.15 acres).

For the past 40 years Mariam has been cultivating groundnuts for its food value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a sauce base in their diet, but also for its commercial value, since she sells groundnuts at the market.

With increasing crop yields and income, Mariam is planning to raise livestock. Finally, she hopes she will be able to finance her children's weddings.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts, and benefit from training in agricultural techniques offered by myAgro.

loans.name: Lalasoa

texts.fr:
Agée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de cinq enfants, Lalasoa est une femme dynamique et débrouillarde. Elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche en tant que machiniste durant long temps. Malheureusement, l'entreprise a dû se fermer en 2009 à cause de la crise politique survenue dans le pays et elle était forcement en chômage technique. De ce fait, elle a dû chercher de quoi faire pour aider son mari à soutenir sa famille et en plus, c'est une femme qui avait l'habitude de travailler et n'aimer pas rester sans rien faire.
Il y a six ans, elle exerce une activité de vente de chaussures et sandales pour dames, elle a démarré avec son propre épargne et  puis après quelque mois a demandé du prêt auprès de CEFOR pour renforcer son commerce.
Actuellement, elle s'oriente pas à pas vers la vente d'autres types d'articles pour complément (ustensiles de cuisines en inox, sous-vêtements).
Avec les bénéfices de son activité et sa bonne gestion, elle a réussi à améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille, acquérir des nouveaux meubles,et renouveler sa maison d'habitation.
Elle espère pouvoir offrir à ses enfants des études universitaires.
texts.en:
Lalasoa, aged 40, is a married mother of five children. She is an energetic woman and a problem-solver. She used to work as a machinist for a long time in a free-zone private company. Unfortunately, the company had to close in 2009 because of the political crisis taking place in the country, and she had to be laid off. So, she had to look for something to help out her husband in supporting her family; you see, this is a woman who is used to working and not enjoying being idle. 

For six years, she has had a business selling women’s shoes and sandals. She started off with her own savings and then, after a few months, requested a loan from CEFOR to bolster her business. Currently, she is focused, one step at a time, on selling other types of items to round things out (stainless steel kitchen utensils, undergarments). 

With the profits from her business and her good managing, she has succeeded in improving the family’s living conditions, acquiring new furniture, and renovating her house. She hopes to be able to provide a university education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, sandals, and undergarments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for her business.

loans.name: Tolotra Onja

texts.pt:
Onja a 37 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de deux enfants de 15 et 10 ans qu' elle élève seule. Ces derniers vont tous actuellement à l'école. Sa mère, seule aussi, vit avec eux trois.
Elle dirige un magasin général et ceci depuis environ 10 ans. Auparavant, elle travaillait comme employée de bureau, mais son salaire ne suffisait pas à couvrir les charges familiales et de plus, elle n'avait pas du temps à s'occuper même un peu de son premier enfant encore en bas âge dans le temps.De ce fait, elle décidait d'ouvrir une épicerie avec son petit économie juste après la naissance de son 2ème enfant.
Elle désire, étendre et développer son affaire, ce qui est la raison de sa demande de crédit.Cette activité est le principal source de revenu de la la famille. Elle tient vraiment à l'améliorer.
texts.en:
Onja is 37 years old. She is a widow and the mother of two children of 10 and 15 years she raises on her own. They both currently attend school. Her mother, also single, lives with the three of them.

She runs a general store and has been doing this for about 10 years. She previously worked as a clerk, but her salary was not sufficient to cover family expenses and what's more, didn't have the time to care even a little for her first child who was in its infancy at the time.

Therefore, she decided to open a grocery store with her meager savings just after the birth of her second child.

She wishes to expand and develop her business, which is the reason why she is requesting a loan. This activity is the main source of income for the family, and she truly wants to improve it.

loans.use: buy cartons of soap, toothpaste, baby diapers, shampoos, pasta, candies, cookies, bags of rice, ...

loans.name: Meltine

texts.fr:
Meltine est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère d'une adorable petite fille de 10 ans qui est actuellement en classe de 7ème. Son mari est couturier dont le revenu est un peu faible et instable. Ils vivent ensemble tous les trois dans une maison à location.
Depuis 2007, elle dirige un petit commerce de petit déjeuner et de collation de spécialité vraiment malagasy d'habitude appelé "kafe sy mofo". On n'y vend que des boissons chaudes  surtout café et des beignets (mofogasy et ramanonaka).
Avant, elle etait femme au foyer mais adorait déjà préparer des goûters, collations ou inventer même des menus pour sa famille. C'est une femme créative. Elle voudrait développer son affaire , proposer d'autres types de beignets et des petits plats pour ses clients, c'est à dire devenir une restauratrice. Elle adore l'art culinaire, elle projette de suivre une formation si nécessaire.
texts.en:
Meltine is 38 years old and a married mother of an adorable little girl, who is 10 and currently in her 7th year of school. Meltine’s husband is a clothier, whose income is low and unstable. Together, all three live in a rented house. 

Since 2007, Meltine has been running a small-scale business selling breakfasts and special Malagasy-style meals usually called "kafe sy mofo". Only hot drinks are sold there, particularly coffee with beignets (mofogasy and ramanonaka). In the past, she was a housewife but already loved to make snacks, light meals, or even invent multi-course meals for her family. She is a creative woman.  

Meltine would like to develop her business and offer other types of beignets and small dishes for her customers; that is, she want to become a restauranteur. She loves the art of cooking. She plans on taking training if necessary.

loans.use: to purchase a mold, flour, sugar, canned milk, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gisella Mariuxi

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Emprendedoras.
En este lugar vive la señora Gisella, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 17 y 6 años de edad, el mayor esta por ingresar en una universidad local y el menor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es Ing. Petrolero y trabaja en EE UU.
Doña Gisella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, carteras entre otras cosas, su marido le envía o le trae cuando el viaja a esta ciudad,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando le llega mercadería nueva, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Lleva más de 4 años con este negocio el cual le deja muy buenos recursos.
Este crédito es para comprar camisetas, pantalones, shores, perfumes  y carteras que ella vende. Lleva más de 3 años en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí that has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Mujeres Emprendedoras Credit Group meet every 15 days.  

This is where Gisella lives; she's 41 years old, married, and has two children who are 17 and 6 years old; the oldest is about to enroll in the local university and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is an oil engineer and works in the US.
