Gisella sells all kinds of clothing, perfumes, and wallets, among other items; her husband sends her or brings her stuff when he travels to the city; she sells door to door though she does the majority of her selling in her home where her customers come when she gets new merchandise; she sells her products on credit and charges every eight days.  She has had her business for over four years and it generates good income for her.  

This loan is to buy shirts, pants, shorts, perfumes, and wallets that she sells.  She has been in the credit group for over three years and she likes it because the loans are fast.  Her dreams are to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts, perfumes, and wallets.

loans.name: Olga Argentina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Emprendedoras.
En este lugar vive la señora Olga, tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera de una hija mayor de edad y aun vive con ella. 
Doña Olga es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar, hace dos años y con la ayuda de los créditos empezó un negocio de venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja tres o cuatro días a la semana y no tiene horarios fijos para salir, aunque más le gusta salir en horas de la mañana o de noche ya que a esa hora es más fresco y realiza sus ventas con más tranquilidad, ella les deja a crédito y cobra cada semana. Asi ella se gana la vida y no tiene que depender de nadie.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños entre otros. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí that has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Mujeres Emprendedoras Credit Group meet every fifteen days.  

This is where Olga lives; she is 62 years old; she is the single mother of an adult daughter and she still lives with her.  

Olga is a woman who has always liked to work; two years ago and with the help of these loans she started a business selling all kinds of clothing; she does her selling door to door; she works three or four days a week and does not have a set schedule for going out, though she likes to go in the morning or at night as it is cooler at these times and it's more comfortable to sell; she sells on credit and charges every week.  In this way, she earns her living and does not have to depend on anyone.  

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, and children's clothing, among other items.  She has been in her credit group for over four years and she likes it because the loans are fast.  Her dreams are to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Esnang

texts.en:
Esnang is 44 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She requested a 22,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more charcoal to sell.

In the future Esnang would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Jacqueline a 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants âgés de 13 et 6 ans. Ces derniers vont tous actuellement à l'école. Quant à son mari, il exerce une activité de vente de sacs et cartables. La famille vie ensemble dans une maison encore appartenant à ses beaux-parents.
Auparavant, Jacqueline travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche, mais depuis 2010, elle a ouvert une petite épicerie avec ses propres économies car elle pensait que travailler dans une zone franche est sans promotion donc sans avenir. C'est une femme travailleuse ayant de l'esprit combattif et qui adore avancer et débrouiller.
Depuis son ouverture, on peut constater vivement le développement de son commerce, son souhait est d'ouvrir un autre magasin grossiste et d'acheter à ses beaux-parents la maison.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 43 years old, is a married mother of two children, aged 13 and 6. The children are both currently in school. As for her husband, he has a business selling bags and satchels. The family lives together in a house still belonging to the in-laws. 

In the past, Jacqueline used to work in a free-zone enterprise. But in 2010, she opened a small grocery store with her own savings, since she was thinking of working in a free zone without offers and so without a future. She is a hard worker with a fighting spirit, and she loves making progress and problem-solving. Since she opened, the development of her business has been strikingly apparent. Her wish is to open another wholesale store and to purchase a house for her in-laws.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, dried vegetables, cooking oil, soap, canned drinks, candles, and pasta

loans.name: Julio Vicente

texts.es: A sus 47 años de edad Julio es un señor soltero, vive con su madre y con un hermano. Julio toda su vida la paso en el campo  y es asi que se dedica a la agricultura de productos como frejol, alverja, papas, entre otros. Julio solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fungicidas, abonos y demás productos que hacen que sus cultivos estén muy buenos y  sanos. Julio tiene la aspiración de mejorar su negocio y seguir velando por el bienestar de su madre.
texts.en: Julio is 47 and is single. He lives with his mother and a brother. Julio has spent his whole life in the countryside and he earns a living in farming produce such as beans, peas and potatoes, among other things. Julio is asking for a loan to buy fungicide, fertiliser and other products to make his crops good and healthy. Julio aspires to improve his business and continue looking after the welfare of his mother.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and fungicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics (linen, Terylene, poplin, plaids, flower prints, etc.

loans.name: Gbenodou Group

texts.fr: Groupement de 12 personnes(06 femmes et 06 hommes), GBENODOU exerce son activité à ANEHO localité située à environ 45km de la ville de Lomé. Ils sont spécialisés dans le stockage du mais et haricot et revend au moment de pénurie sur le marché. Pour acheter beaucoup de marchandises, ce groupement demande un troisième prêt à WAGES pour atteindre leurs objectifs. Chaque membre du groupe souhaite améliorer son activité et assurer la scolarité et la santé de leurs enfants. Nottons que le responsable du groupe à 41ans, père de 05 enfants. Il est spécialisé dans la culture du mais et du manioc.
texts.en:
The 'Gbenodou' group is made up of twelve people (six women and six men).  The group is based in Aneho, around forty-five kilometres from the town of Lomé.  They are specialists in buying maize and beans when the price is low, stocking it and then selling it when the price rises due to shortage of supply.

This will be the third loan for the group from the field partner, WAGES, and it will help them achieve their business goals.  All the group members are working to improve their business and provide schooling and healthcare for their children.

The group representative is forty-one years old and father to five children.  He is a specialist in growing maize and cassava.

loans.use: to buy stock for their cereal selling business.

loans.name: Elsa Del Carmen

texts.es: Elsa, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, reside en una comunidad de la Masica, Atlántida junto a su familia. En busca de obtener ingresos, hace 5 años decidió poner su propio negocio y lo ha ubicado en una cafetería de una escuela, donde vende variedad de golosinas y comidas como ser baleadas, pastelitos rellenos con carne, refrescos, churros, galletas, confites, jugos, tajadas con carne y pollo y otros. Ella ya solicito un préstamo anteriormente en la institución y ahora solicita otro ciclo que es por 12,000 lempiras para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y mantenerlo surtido de productos de refrescos, golosinas e insumos para la elaboración y venta de comidas, además piensa comprar un poco de ropa para vender y obtener otros ingresos. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Elsa is 31 years old, she is married and has two children. She lives in a community in la Masica, Atlántida with her family. Five years ago, in the search to earn an income, she decided to start her own business and she has located it in a school cafeteria where she sells a variety of sweets and food such as filled flour tortillas, meat stuffed pastries, soft drinks, churros, biscuits, sweets, juices, fried plantains with meat and chicken and others. She previously applied for a loan from the institution and she is now applying for another loan cycle for 12,000 lempiras to continue to invest in her business and keep it stocked up with products such as soft drinks, sweets and supplies for making and selling food. She is also thinking about buying a small amount of clothes to sell to earn another income. Her aim is to make her business grow and to be able to move ahead with her family.

loans.use: to stock up her business with soft drinks, sweets and supplies for making and selling food and buying clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Maria Carmen Bertilde

texts.es: María es una señora muy alegre, esta en sus 64 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y su hijo ya es mayor de edad y  trabaja al jornal en el campo. María comenta que por medio de la agricultura es como pudo sacar adelante a su hijo y que por lo menos no le haga falta la alimentación. María vive en una casita hecha de barro (tierra) que es muy humilde. Con el dinero del crédito María va a comprar los productos que sean necesarios para sus cultivos de frejol, higos, quinua y mas,  por ejemplo  María va a comprar abono, fungicidas, pago de ano obra, pagar del riego de agua. María tiene su aspiración de seguir trabajando en su negocio ya que comenta que a su edad ya necesita tener los ingresos necesarios para su salud.
texts.en: María is a very happy woman. She is 64 years old. She is a single mother and her son is an adult and works in the fields daily. María says that through agriculture she has been able to provide for her son and at least he isn't lacking food. María lives in a house made of mud (dirt) that is very humble. With the loan money, María is going to buy the products that are necessary for her crops of beans, quinoa and more. For example, María is going to buy fertilizer, fungicides, a year of paid work, and pay for irrigation water. María has an aspiration of continuing to work in her business since she says that at her age she needs to have the necessary income for her health.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don José, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, Reside en un sector que pertenece al municipio de San Pedro Sula, y vive con su esposa y un nieto. José siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, inicio con la venta de chicharrones de soya y luego comenzó a vender alcancías hechas de barro o arcilla, estas alcancías las compra y las revende y tienen diferentes diseños y colores. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener activo su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar mas alcancías y surtir y vender para incrementar las ganancias y su clientela. Su plan es seguir con el negocio ya que es su fuente principal de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: José is 54 years old. He is married and has 3 older children. He lives in a neighborhood that belongs to the town of San Pedro Sula and lives with his wife and a grandson. José has always made a living in business. He began with selling soybean cracklings and later began to sell piggy banks made of mud or clay. He buys these piggy banks and resells them and they have different designs and colors. He has asked for various loans to keep his business active. At the moment, he is asking for another for 10,000 Lempiras to buy more piggy banks to stock up and sell, in order to increase his earnings and his clientele. His plan is to continue with the business since it is his main source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy more piggy banks to stock up and sell.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Motivada por su madre quién es propietaria de un almacén de ropa ubicado en el municipio de Tabio en el departamento de Cundinamarca, Amparo, hace cuatro años exhibe en una vitrina en el local de su mamá tarjetas de invitación para ocasiones especiales como matrimonios, bautizos y  primeras comuniones, realiza su labor de ventas desde el negocio de su madre y elabora las tarjetas desde su vivienda de acuerdo a las especificaciones del cliente, esta creativa mujer también elabora accesorios para el cabello como diademas, hebillas y lazos en distintos colores, texturas y motivos.  Amparo es muy comprometida y responsable, todos los días en el horario de 8 a.m. a  7 p.m. esta dispuesta a atender a los clientes que visitan el almacén y realizar sus compras o simplemente cotizan. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en una impresora, papel, cintas y accesorios.  Esta inversión es muy necesaria para ella, puesto que compromete directamente su producción; agiliza la entrega de los encargos y con ello la reinversión.  Amparo de 29 años es madre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes desea brindarles una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Motivated by her mother who owns a clothes shop located in the municipality of Tabio in the department of Cundinamarca, four years ago Amparo displayed in the window of her mothers premises invitation cards for special occasions such as weddings, baptisms and first communion. She sells from her mothers business and she makes the cards from her home to the specifications of the customer. She is a creative woman and she also makes hair accessories such as headbands, clasps and bows in different colours, textures and patterns. Amparo is very committed and responsible. Every day she works from 8am to 7pm and is available to tend to her customers who visit the shop and buy things or simply to get a quote. She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first type of funding offered by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a printer, paper, ribbon and accessories. This investment really is necessary for her as it directly affects her production, speeds up her completion of orders and with this, allows for reinvestment. Amparo is 29 years old and is a mother of two young children who she wants to give the best quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a printer, paper, ribbon and accessories.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa es una joven estudiante de Licenciatura en Administración de empresas, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Maria Teresa, tengo 20 años de edad, nací en Sabana Yegua, de la Provincia Azua de Compostela, pero Vivo en Santo Domingo. Soy cristiana por convicción, actualmente trabajo en una empresa como asistente de finanzas, soy de pocos recursos económicos pues mi salario tengo que costear mi sustento, transporte y pagar la casa donde vivo con mi madre. Mis padres no cuentan con los recursos suficientes para poder ayudar a costear mis estudios. 
Mi padre nació en San Juan de Herrera, San Juan de la Maguana, actualmente vive en Sabana Yegua, es agricultor. Mi madre nació en Peralta, de Azua de Compostela, vive conmigo porque la mayoría de mis hermanos están casados. 
Quiero estudiar Licenciatura en Administración de empresa en la Universidad APEC, es una carrera con grandes oportunidades de empleo y fácil acceso con la cual puedo mejorar mis ingresos incluso crear mi propia empresa en un futo. Deseo este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de matrícula ya que mis ingresos son insuficientes, sin la ayuda de este préstamo no podría cumplir mi meta de ser profesional.
En espera de verme favorecida en mi petición, y agradeciéndole sobremanera su atención a esta particular, se despide de ustedes.
Maria Teresa.
texts.en: Maria Teresa is a young student pursuing a degree in business administration. She is requesting the loan to cover her education expenses. This is her story: My name is Maria Teresa. I'm 20 years old. I was born in Sabana Yegua, province of Azua de Compostela, but I live in Santo Domingo. I am a devout Christian, and I currently work as a financial assistant for a business. I come from few economic resources, so my wages are my livelihood, paying for transportation and the home I live in with my mother. My parents don't have the resources to be able to help pay for my education. My father was born in San Juan de Herrera and currently lives in Sabana Yegua and is a farmer. My mother was born in Peralta, province of Azua Compostela, and lives with me because the majority of my siblings are married. I want to study business administration at APEC University. It is a career with great employment opportunities that are easily accessible so I can increase my income and even create my own business in the future. I desire this loan to be able to cover my tuition since my income isn't enough, and without this loan I would not be able to reach my goal of being a professional. I say goodbye in hopes that you view my request favorably and thank you deeply for your time. Maria Teresa.

loans.use: cover higher education costs.

loans.name: El Pípila Group

texts.es:
Al llegar a cierta comunidad de Veracruz se aprecian los extensos sembradíos de caña de azúcar, maíz, frijol, piña y algodón que los campesinos atienden con mucho trabajo y agradecimiento a la tierra. El paisaje rural es agradable a la vista y relajante para quien lo visita. 
   En dicho poblado se formó el grupo El Pípila para solicitar un préstamo a VisiónFund México e invertirlo en sus actividades. Las integrantes del grupo son: Cecilia quien vende abarrotes; Amalia, pollo; Minerva, agua purificada; Janet, calzado por catálogo; Minerva C. y Mercedes, carne de cerdo y Andrea, refresco. 
   Con el claro objetivo de brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y obtener sus propios ingresos doña Amalia inició con la venta de pollo. Para Janet lo más importante son sus hijos, una joven de dieciocho años y un adolescente de doce, quienes le ayudan con los quehaceres del hogar. 
   Gracias a sus ahorros y el apoyo de su esposo Rubén, Janet compró quince pollos, una báscula, bolsas y una cubeta, de esta forma comenzó en la actividad. Desde entonces se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para prender el fogón, después coloca la cubeta con agua donde lava los pollos para tener lista la carne y comenzar a venderla.
    El préstamo lo ha solicitado para comprar treinta pollos ya que sus clientes han solicitado varios pedidos. Los planes para Doña Amalia son claros “hacer un corral mejor, criar y vender pollos es lo que espero lograr con cada uno de los préstamos que me sean otorgados, este es sólo el principio” comenta mientras atiende gustosamente a un cliente.
   *La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casad de Doña Minerva C., detrás de ellas se puede apreciar un sembradío de maíz; Doña Amalia es quien viste blusa color verde.
texts.en: Around a certain community in Veracruz are extensive crops of sugar cane, corn, beans, pineapple and cotton that the people tend to with a lot of work and care for the land. The rural landscape is pleasing and soothing to those who visit. It is here the El Pípila Group formed to request a loan from VisiónFund México and invest in their activities. The members of the group are: Cecilia, who sells groceries; Amalia, who sells chicken; Minerva, who sells purified water; Janet, who sells shoes via catalog; Minerva C. and Mercedes, who both sell pork; and Andrea, who sells refreshments. With the clear objective of providing her family with a better quality of life and to earn her own income, Amalia started her business selling chicken. For Amalia, the most important thing are her children, ages 18 and 12, who help her with household chores. Thanks to her savings and the support of her husband, Rubén, Amalia purchased 15 chickens, a scale, bags and buckets, and in this way she started her business. Since then she gets up every morning at 5 to light the fireplace, then she fills a bucket with water to wash the chicken and get the meat ready, then she starts to sell it. She is requesting the loan to purchase 30 chickens since her customers are making various orders. Amalia's plans are clear, "make a better coop, and raise and sell chickens. This is what I hope to achieve with each loan that is granted me, and this is only the beginning," she said while happily tending to a customer. *The photograph was taken in front of the house of Minerva C., behind the group is a corn field; Amalia is wearing the green blouse.

loans.use: purchase 30 chickens

location.town: LOCALIDAD POBLADO DOS  Del. / Mun. COSAMALOAPAN  E

loans.name: Micaela Antonieta

texts.es:
Micaela es una madre de familia de 60 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades  entre 30 y 39 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Micaela con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de comida y refacciones tiene 25 años de realizar esta labor, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica  a la crianza de animales de corral.
Micaela gracias a la dedicación con la que prepara la comida tiene muchos clientes, es por ello que ahora necesita de un capital para comprar sus utensilios como ollas, cuchillos, cucharas, para preparar mejor los alimentos, por tal razón solicita un préstamo.
El gran sueño de Micaela es instalar una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes, y que sus hijos tengan un terreno.
texts.en:
Micaela, 60, is married and the mother of a lovely family of four children, ages 30 to 39.  This humble family lives in a community in Santo Tomas La Union.

In an effort to earn an income and provide for her family, Micaela sells food and meals and has been in business for 25 years.  She also raises barnyard animals to increase her income.

Thanks to her dedication in preparing meals, Micaela has many customers.  So now she is in need of capital to buy utensils such as pans, knives and spoons so she can prepare the food better.  This is why she is requesting a loan.

Micaela's goal is to open a grocery store and to buy land for her children.

loans.use: To buy utensils such as pans, knives and spoons.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Las Colibrí Group

texts.es:
Las Colibrí es el nombre de un grupo conformado por ocho mujeres emprendedoras que radican en una comunidad del Estado de Veracruz. Dicha región es notable por sus altas temperaturas ya que durante el día se alcanzan hasta los 40°C.
   El nombre del grupo fue elegido por la majestuosidad de la pequeña ave que motiva a las integrantes a ser persistentes en la búsqueda de sus sueños. Ellas son: Susana quien vende cosméticos; Nadia, cosméticos y recipientes; Vianey y Carol Ann, ropa; Alejandra, pasteles; Perla, bisutería. Por su lado Samanta tiene una estética y María, además de una estética, tiene un café internet. 
   Doña Vinaey es una mujer respetable en su comunidad, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace ocho años. Lo que la motiva es su familia conformada por Abraham, su esposo, y dos hijas que estudian actualmente, “los hijos van creciendo y se necesita más dinero para brindarles una buena calidad de vida” comenta. 
   Después de vender de manera ambulante durante tres años, logró abrir un local en casa de tal forma que ya no tiene necesidad de recorrer las calles cuando el calor está en su punto más alto. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pantalones por mayoreo para dama y caballero de tal manera que los precios que ofrece a sus clientes son más accesibles.
   Con las ganancias obtenidas y el salario de su esposo han solventado los gastos de la casa y la educación de sus hijas además de reinvertir en su mercancía. Aunado a lo anterior, participó en cursos que de repostería y ahora también se dedica a la elaboración y venta de postres y pasteles. A futuro, le gustaría abrir una pastelería para seguir aplicando lo aprendido. 
  Las integrantes del grupo Las Colibrí agradecen  la confianza y trato que han recibido por parte de VisionFund para crecer económicamente.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Doña Nadia, Vianey es quien viste blusa estampada y short blanco.
texts.en: Las Colibrí (Hummingbird) is the name of this group consisting of eight working women who reside in the community of Estado de Veracruz. This region is notable for its high temperatures, which during the day can reach 40°C (104°F). The name of the group comes from the majesty of the little bird, which motivates the members to be persistent in search of their dreams. The members are: Susana, who sells cosmetics; Nadia, who sells cosmetics and containers; Vianey and Carol Ann, who both sell clothes; Alejandra, who sells cakes; Perla, who sells costume jewelry; Samantha has a salon; and Maria also has a salon as well as an internet cafe. Vianey is a respectable woman in her community who has sold clothing for the past eight years. She is motivated by her family, which consists of her husband, Abraham, and her two daughters who are in school. "The kids keep growing and more money is needed to provide them a good quality of life," she says. After selling without a fixed location for three years, she was able to open a store in her home, so she no long needs to travel the streets when it gets really hot. She plans to use the loan to buy pants for men and women at wholesale and in this way she can offer her customers more accessible prices. With her earnings and the salary of her husband, they have been able to pay the bills and pay for their daughters' education, and she has renewed her stock of clothes. Added to this, she has taken confectionary classes and is now making and selling pastries and cakes. In the future, she would like to open a pastry shop and start applying what she learned. The members of Las Colibrí group are grateful for the confidence and treatment they have received from VisionFund to grow economically. *The photograph was taken on the patio of Nadia; Vianey is in the print blouse and white shorts.

loans.use: to purchase pants for men and women.

loans.name: Neris  Antonio

texts.es:
Neris es un pequeño caficultor del norte de Nicaragua. Cuenta con 3.52 hectáreas de café, la cual atiende junto a su esposa, y manejan bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.
 
En los últimos tres años, el cafetal de Neris se ha visto afectado por la roya, que es una enfermedad que daña las hojas de las plantas, y baja la productividad de la plantación. Para restablecer las condiciones de café, este pequeño emprendedor está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar los insumos que requiere su cafetal para mejorar la nutrición de sus plantas y alcanzar una buena cosecha este ciclo, y con ello mayores ingresos para continuar mejorando las condiciones de su familia.

La meta de Neris y su esposa es mejorar la productividad de su finca,  y consideran que estas inversiones son necesarias para poder aumentar su producción de café y los ingresos que perciben por este rubro.
texts.en:
Neris is a small coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua.  He has 3.52 hectares of coffee plantation which he and his wife attend to.  They work under the criteria of the fair trade certifications: UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices.

Over the last few years Neris' coffee crops have been affected by rust spots, a disease which affects plant leaves and lowers production.  In order to return the coffee to normal conditions, this small entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy supplies to improve crop nutrition and obtain a good harvest this season.  His aim is to improve his income and his family's living conditions.

Neris and his wife have a goal of improving farm productivity and they feel it is necessary to carry out this investment to increase coffee production and the income they receive from this trade.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to care for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a bathroom to make her house more hygienic for her guests.

loans.name: Juan Jose Daniel

texts.es: Juan, tiene 32 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece a la comunidad de Florida Copan, cerca a Nueva Frontera. Anteriormente con su familia se dedicaba a la ganadería y luego decidió dedicarse a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café. Este cultivo lo realiza en su propio terreno y la producción la vende en el mercado o intermediarios d ela zona. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo con la institución y es por 10,500 Lempiras para invertirlo en abonos, y en limpieza para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café, lo que le ayudara a sacar mejor cosecha. Su plan a futuro es comprar mas tierra para sembrar mas café y darle bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 32, and his common-law wife have two children.  They live in a community in Florida Copan near Nueva Frontera.  The family used to work in livestock farming but then decided to grow corn, beans and coffee.  They work on their own land and sell their produce at market and to merchants in the area.

This is Juan's second loan through the institution.  He will use the 10,500 HNL to buy fertilizer and provide cleaning and maintenance for his coffee plantation, which will produce a better harvest.  His plan for the future is to buy more land to plant coffee and to give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay to get his coffee plantation cleaned.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer emprendedora de 55 años de edad, que vive en su pequeña finca con 4 hijos, en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. En su finca cuenta con 1.4 hectáreas de café, la cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo.

En el ciclo pasado, ella estuvo atenta para controlar el riesgo que representa la enfermedad de la roya, que afectó varias plantaciones de café de su zona. Logró que los efectos en su finca no fueran mayores, sin embargo su producción disminuyó, por lo que para este ciclo está solicitando un préstamo para adquirir los insumos que requiere su cafetal para un buen mantenimiento, y asegurar una buena cosecha.

Ella sueña con dejar un patrimonio a sus hijos, un medio con el que puedan mejorar sus ingresos económicos  y tener mejores condiciones y oportunidades que las que ella ha tenido, y está segura que la caficultura es una actividad económica rentable, con lo cual puede alcanzar su meta.
texts.en:
Carmen is an enterprising woman who is 55 years of age. She lives on her small plantation with 4 children in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua. She has 1.4 hectares of coffee on her plantation, which she manages according to the certification standards of fair trade.

Last season, she was careful to guard against the rust disease, which affected several coffee plantations in her area. She was successful in that its effect on her plantation wasn't great, but her production was still reduced. For this season she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase supplies for her plantation in order to maintain it and ensure a good harvest. 

Her dream is to leave an inheritance for her children, with which they will be able to improve their income and have better conditions and opportunities than the ones that she has had. She is sure that coffee growing is a profitable enterprise that will enable her to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy supplies that she will use for her coffee plantation in order to have a good harvest

loans.name: Guadalupe Cote Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe Cote es un grupo conformado por mujeres alegres y con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Ellas viven en una amable comunidad mazahua, los habitantes siempre se muestran sonrientes, la calidez humana hace sentirse realmente en familia. Existe una gran presa en donde los habitantes acuden a lavar ropa o bañarse, de igual forma crían pescados en sus aguas para prepararlos en ricos platillos para toda la familia. Además, la región se caracteriza por tener a los mejores panaderos, ellos elaboran el tradicional pan de burro o de piojo y el bolillo, entre otras delicias.
   Irene es la más joven del grupo todos la ubican por ser muy divertida, está casada desde hace cuatro años con Juan con quien comparte el oficio de panadero, ellos son padres de un niño pequeño. 
   Actualmente ella y su esposo trabajan cada tercer día en la elaboración de su producto. Su técnica es mezclar todos los ingredientes y amasar con fuerza  y rapidez para obtener una masa más uniforme y moldeable. Posteriormente cortan la masa en distintas figuras ya que de inmediato debe pasar al horno donde la leña lo mantiene a la temperatura ideal. Nunca desperdician el calor del horno así que deben tener la masa necesaria para aprovechar al máximo la leña. Los días siguientes salen a vender el pan en los mercados de la comunidad. "Hacer pan en nuestra familia ha pasado de generación en generación, nosotros decidimos iniciar con el negocio porque mi suegro nos enseñó y apoyó" comentó sonriente Irene. 
   Las cuatro integrantes del grupo se dedican a elaborar pan y todas necesitan el apoyo del préstamo para comprar materia prima como harina, huevo, levadura, leña, etc. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Irene es quien porta la chamarra azul*
texts.en:
Guadalupe Cote is a group of cheerful women with a great entrepreneurial spirit. They liven in a lovely Mazahua community. The inhabitants are always smiling, and the human warmth makes one really feel at home.

There is a big place, where the people come together to wash their clothes or take a bath. Here, they also grow fish to prepare tasty meals for the whole family. Moreover, the region is known for having the best bakers. They bake traditional bread, such delicacies as the "pan de burro" [donkey bread], the "pan de piojo" [flea bread] or bread rolls.

Irene is the youngest of the group and everyone says she is very funny. She has been married for four years to Juan, with whom she runs the baking business. They are parents to a small child.

At the moment, she and her husband work every third day baking the bread. They mix all the ingredients together and knead strongly and quickly to get the most uniform and malleable dough. Afterwards, they cut the dough into the different shapes and put it immediately into the oven, where firewood maintains the ideal temperature. They never waste any heat, so they have to have the right amount of dough to make optimal use of the firewood. The following days they go out to sell the bread on the markets in town. 

"Baking bread has been passed on in our family for generations. We decided to start the business because when my father-in-law showed us how to and supported us," says Irene smiling.

The four members of the group earn a living by baking bread and they all need the support of this loan to buy raw material, such as flour, eggs, yeast, firewood, and so on.

(The photo was taken in the town's garden. Irene is the one wearing a blue jacket.)

loans.use: to buy yeast, flour, firewood, and so on.

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ángela Mónica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Emprendedoras.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun  viven en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en construcción. Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia de la ciudad.
Doña Ángela es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ganarse lo suyo y con sus ganancias ir mejorando su situación económica, ella tienen un salón de belleza en un local que arrienda en el centro de la ciudad, allí realiza diversos trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal,  trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 21h00 y si algún cliente requiere  de sus servicios hasta más tarde. Así ella se gana la vida desde hace 14 años que lleva realizando sus trabajos que le sirven para salir adelante y mas en ocasiones que su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar esmaltes, tintes y otros materiales de belleza que ella emplea en sus trabajos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus metas son tener un gran salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the credit group Mujeres Emprendedoras [Entrepreneurial Women] meet in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí and known as the "city of the royal tamarind trees".

Angela lives here. She is fifty years old, married and the couple has three adult children. Two of them still live with her. Her husband is a construction worker. Years ago she studied cosmetics in one of the city's academies.

Angela is a woman who likes to work, make her own money and be able to improve her financial situation with the income. She runs a beauty salon in a store she rents in the city center. Here, she offers various beauty and grooming services. She works every day from 9 am until 9 pm, and even later if a customer needs her services.

This way, she has been earning a living for 14 years. Through her work she has been able to improve her financial situation, especially when occasionally her husband had no job.

She will use this loan to buy nail polish, dye, and other cosmetic products to use in her services. She has been with the credit group for four loan cycles and likes it because of the help the loans provide. Her aim is to have a great beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, dye, and other cosmetic products.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Para poder adentrase en cierta comunidad veracruzana se debe viajar en vehículo particular de lo contrario se debe caminar de 25 a 30 minutos debido a la escasez de transporte. Lo que más les gusta a los habitantes del lugar es vivir rodeados de vegetación y grandes extensiones de sembradíos cañeros. Una de las actividades comunes es la operación de maquinaria pesada que sirve para la extracción de arena y piedra de la cantera local.
   En dicha comunidad se formó el grupo llamado Sol Naciente, los integrantes y sus actividades son Guadalupe quien vende ropa; Teresa, abarrotes; Nallely, ropa; María y América, antojitos típicos; Ana, zapatos; Mireya, frutas y Roxana cría y vende cerdos. 
   Doña Teresa es conocida como Tere entre familiares y amigos, es una mujer muy dedicada y alegre. Su esposo, Don Ciro, es productor de mango y aprovecha la temporada para cosechar el producto y venderlo a las industrias que procesan el fruto para vender jugo. Ellos tienen tres hijos menores de edad de los cuales dos están cursando sus estudios académicos en la comunidad. 
   Con el propósito de apoyar a su esposo y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, Tere acondicionó dos cuartos dentro de su casa donde y colocó anaqueles de metal para iniciar una tienda de abarrotes. Desde hace nueve años ofrece la mejor variedad de productos a sus clientes para que no tengan que trasladarse hasta el centro del municipio.
   Con la oportunidad del préstamo podrá invertir en la compra de queso, frijol, arroz, azúcar, café, leche, huevos, galletas, refrescos, frituras, detergente y papel higiénico para continuar ofreciendo un extenso surtido a sus clientes.  Con las ganancias obtenidas, además de apoyar a su esposo, solventa los gastos regulares y reinvierte en mercancía; de igual forma ha ahorrado para iniciar con la cría y venta de cerdos para ampliar su negocio.
   “Gracias por confiar en nosotros, otorgarnos estos préstamos, motivarnos para iniciar nuevas actividades y orientarnos para fortalecer las que ya tenemos” son  palabras de los integrantes del grupo.

*En la imagen las integrantes de Sol Naciente, doña Tere es quien viste blusa color rojo.
texts.en:
In order to enter a certain Veracruz community, one has to travel in a private vehicle, or else walk 25 to 30 minutes due to a lack of transportation. What the residents of the place like the most is living surrounded by vegetation and sugar cane fields. One of the common activities is heavy machine operating to extract sand and stone from the local quarry.  

In said community, a group called Sol Naciente was born. The members and their activities are Guadalupe, who sells clothes, Teresa, groceries, Nallely, clothes, María and América, traditional food, Ana, shoes, Mireya, fruit and Roxana, who raises and sells pigs. 

Teresa is known as Tere to her family and friends. She is a hardworking and cheerful woman. Her husband, Ciro, is a mango grower. He takes advantage of the season to grow the product and sell it to industries that process the fruit for juice. They have three young children who go to school in the community.

In order to help her husband and offer a better quality of life to her children Tere set up two rooms in her house where she put metal shelving to start a general store. For nine years, she has offered the best variety of products to her customers so that they don't have to go to the town center.

With the opportunity of this loan, she can invest in buying cheese, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, cookies, beverages, fried foods, detergent and toilet paper in order to continue offering a wide variety to her customers. With the profits, in addition to helping her husband, she pays for regular expenses and reinvests in merchandise. In addition, she has saved to start raising and selling pigs to expand her business.

"Thank you for putting your trust in us, giving us these loans, and motivating us to start new activities to fortify what we already have," are the words of the group members.

*In the image of the members of  Sol Naciente, Tere is wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: to buy cheese, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, cookies, fried food, detergent and toilet paper.

loans.name: Mariyam's Group

texts.en:
Mariyam is 41 years old. She is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials to enhance her work. 

This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Mariyam is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Mariyam is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her own clothing stitching work using a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sayhuna

texts.en:
Sayhuna is a cheerful young girl. She was born in west-northern part of Tajikistan in 1993. She is single and lives with her parents in small town. Almost a year she works as an accountant in company. After graduation of high school she entered to university at part time department. Now, she is fourth year student and studies with excellence. 

Her mother is sick and needs a surgical operation. She appealed to IMON asking financial help to treat her mother in a medical clinic. She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and hopes her mother will be better when she will get her surgery

loans.use: to pay for a surgical operation on her mother in a medical clinic

loans.name: Sawe Rahayu Indah Group

texts.en:
With the current loan, Ni Komang purchased more tools to make cakes such as a blender, a mixer and also some ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and chocolate. Every times she sell a cake, she’s set aside for saving and prepare for the payment. She really happy for that, because during the period of the loan, she can sells a lot of cakes and have enough saving. The profit can fullfil the daily life and for most is support the capital for her business. She’s very grateful for MUK,KIVA and Lenders for supporting her business. She said she will always needs assistance from the Loan Officer of MUK to give advice and solution for the business. 
2 members resign after they had enough saving and profit. They will continue their business with their own money.

In order to further enhance earnings in their businesses, Ni Komang and the whole group of Sawe Mutiara Indah continue lending to MUK. They are very satisfied with the services provided, so they agree to develop the businesses. Ni Komang, beside as a cake maker, she also has a business as a pig breeder. She makes many type of cakes and sell to the salesman who come to her house. Now Ni Komang already has 2 pigs and 5 piglets and she uses the loan to buy super quality pig feed and ingredients to make cake, such as flour, sugar, milk and chocolate. Ni Komang still expects the assistance from MUK to business consulting. Profits will be saved for the future needs.

In the meeting, 1 member can’t attended because of illness.

loans.use: to buy super quality feed and ingredients to make cakes, such as flour, sugar, milk and chocolate

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira is a 35-year-old married mother of one son and she lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has owned a ready made ladies' undergarments sale business for the last six years. She purchases undergarment articles from the market at a low price and sells them on at a profitable price at her home. 

She has built up very close relationships with the ladies of her society. The ladies of the town like her undergarment collection and selection a lot. Now that the summer season has started here in Pakistan, she wants to buy a variety of summer season undergarments to sell. But she does not have the amount of money to do so due to her household expenses. Therefore, Saira requested a loan so that she can buy more attractive ladies' undergarments which are better quality for the summer season to meet the demand. Saira wishes for a bright future for her child and her dream is to provide a better education for him. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ladies undergarments for her own selling business.

loans.name: El Angel Group

texts.es:
La ciudad veracruzana conocida como "La novia del sol" tiene un clima realmente cálido, cualidad que comparten sus habitantes ya que son muy amigables con los visitantes que llegan a su región. La actividad económica se compone del auto empleo de ganadería, agricultura y comercio así como las tiendas departamentales que son una fuente de trabajo para los habitantes.
   En una de las colonias cercana a una antigua hacienda se ha formado un grupo llamado El Ángel, los integrantes son: Flor quien vende medicina naturista; Aída, artículos de cerámica; Gilberto, mariscos y carne; Victoria, pollo; Guadalupe, zapatos; Luis, accesorios para celular; Silvia, repostería y María lleva una negocio de cocina. 
   Doña Aida es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado para brindar lo mejor a su familia. Hace 20 años inició con la venta de cerámica, al principio compraba la mercancía únicamente en la capital de México, pero con el paso del tiempo y debido a la demanda de sus clientes, ahora también compra en Guadalajara y Cuernavaca, ciudades ubicadas en otros estados del país.
   Aída siempre ha tenido pasión por las ventas “soy comerciante, lo traigo en los genes, mis padres eran comerciantes y, gracias a ellos soy lo que soy” comenta. Ella ofrece facilidades de pago a sus clientes lo que le ayuda a mejorar sus ventas y ganancias las cuales hoy en día emplea en gastos del hogar, además de pagar la mercancía que compra a crédito.
  Doña Aída vende de manera ambulante pero también lo hace en su casa, un día a la semana vende en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó con láminas para protegerse del sol. En un par de alambres cuelga algunas piezas y otras más las coloca en una mesa. Los fines de semana también vende a la orilla de la carretera; para exhibir sus productos coloca algunas rejillas: “soy de la calle” son sus palabras al referirse a sus puntos de venta predilectos.
   Esta vez el préstamo lo empleará para liquidar el crédito de la mercancía que adquirió el mes pasado, para después reinvertir en más piezas de cerámica.
El grupo agradece por los préstamos otorgados, con los cuales algunos han iniciado una actividad y otros han fortalecido la que tenían.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Doña Flor, Doña Aida es quien viste blusa color rosa.
texts.en:
The Veracruz city known as "La Novia del Sol" has a really warm climate. Its residents share this quality, as they are very friendly to visitors in the area. The financial activity is made up of self employment in livestock, agriculture, and commerce as well as stores, which are a source of employment for the residents.

In one of the neighborhoods close to an old hacienda a group has been formed called El Ángel. The members are Flor, who sells natural medicine, Aída, ceramic items, Gilberto, seafood and meat, Victoria, chicken, Guadalupe, shoes, Luis, cell phone accessories, Silvia, pastries and María, who has a cooking business.
 
Aida is a woman who has always worked to give her family the best. Twety years ago, she started selling ceramics. At first, she would buy the merchandise only in the capital of Mexico. But over time and due to her customers' demands, she now also buys in Guadalajara and Cuernavaca, cities located in other states in the country. 

Aída has always had a passion for sales. "I am a merchant, it's in my genes. My parents were merchants, and thanks to them, I am what I am," she remarks. She offers ease of payment to her customers who help her improve her sales and profits which she uses now for household expenses as well as for paying for the merchandise she buys on credit. 

Aída sells as a street vendor but she also sells from her home. One day a week she sells at a small space she set up with metal sheeting for protection from the sun. On a couple of wires, she hangs some pieces and others she puts on a table. On weekends, she also sells by the side of the road. In order to show off her products, she uses some grills. “I am of the street" are the words she uses to refer to her preferred points of sale.

This time, she will use the loan to settle the debt for the merchandise she acquired last month to later reinvest in more ceramic pieces. The group is grateful for the loans, with which some of them have started an activity and others have fortified the ones they had.  

*The photograph was taken in Flor's patio and Aida is wearing a red blouse.

loans.use: to settle the debt for merchandise she bought on credit.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en: Nodira is a cheerful girl. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in village with her family. She is single and does business by herself. She does business of buying and selling vegetables and fruits for almost three years. She has permanent clients and likes her activity. She is sick and wants to be treated at a hospital. She appealed to IMON and asked for a help to take a loan to be treated in a medical clinic. She hopes that Kiva lenders will support her and she can continue her business to feed her family.

loans.use: to be treated in a medical clinic so as to be able to resume work

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is the age of 30, living in Lahore, with her family. Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has been using salon instruments for many years; Worn out instruments need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments but his financial condition does not allow him to buy new instruments.
 
Due to his low purchasing power, Shazia requested a loan so that her husband can become empowered and he can easily buy new instruments such as scissors, combs, shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair.

Shazia hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to make some saving for household expenses. Shazia thanks  Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new instruments for her husband's barber shop

loans.name: Eline

texts.en: Eline is 23 years old. She owns a shop and she has been in the business for the past 2 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more Colgate and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare. In future, she wishes to earn at least 100,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more Colgate and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Yelba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yelba es una mujer emprendedora que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Junto con su esposo y sus 4 hijos se dedica a la producción de café, el cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de comercio justo.

El ciclo pasado su finca se vio afectada por la enfermedad de la roya, lo que hizo que sus niveles de cosecha disminuyeran hasta en un 50%, por lo que para este nuevo ciclo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permitan implementar el plan de mantenimiento que requiere su cafetal, a fin de mejorar los rendimientos y calidad de su cosecha.

La meta de esta pequeña emprendedora es restablecer las condiciones de su cafetal para poder tener una mayor productividad en su finca y aumentar los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Yelba is a very enterprising women who lives in a rural community in northern Nicaragua. Together with her husband and her four children, she runs a coffee farm, certified under fair trade criteria.

Last season her farm was affected by the coffee leaf rust disease (roya), which reduced their crop by up to 50 percent. This is why she is requesting this loan this season, to buy fertilizer and manure, which will help her to introduce the maintenance plan her coffee plants need to finally improve the yield and quality of her crop.

The goal of this small entrepreneur is to restore the condition of her coffee plants to be able to increase the farm's productivity as well as the income to cover the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to help to restore the conditions of her coffee plants.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is happy woman. She was born in west-northern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is widow and has a child. She lives in a rural area with her family. More than nine years she does a business sewing traditional clothes for women. She likes her activity and has permanent clients every day. 

She wants to continue her activity and earn money to feed her family. Her child is going to enter to University. She had not enough saved up money to pay tuition fee of her child. She appealed to IMON asking for a help to pay higher education costs. She hopes to be supported and her child will study at University.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs of her child

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of farmers. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. She is a hardworking, honest and responsible person. She has 15 years of practice sewing traditional women's dresses. She is satisfied with her activity and is well known around her friends and neighbors. 

She is sick and wishes to be treated at a hospital. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders and IMON to get treatment at a hospital. 

She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a hard-working female entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines and she is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

She supplements this income with earnings by farming rice and corn.

Sylvia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 65 years old, a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Florencia has a buying and selling vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

Florencia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Heber Efrain

texts.es: Heber, tiene 29 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos con su esposa con quien vive en un sector del Municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Heber anteriormente se dedicaba a la construcción y en una panadería. Con su experiencia decidió tener su propio negocio de compra y venta de pan. Lleva 6 años de hacer esta actividad, vende pan dulce, simple, juguitos, espumias y distribuye en pulperías movilizándose con su vehículo. Ha solicitado dos prestamos anteriores en la institución para su negocio y actualmente solicita el tercer ciclo que es por 15,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar pan de contado para vender y ganarle mas. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio, para ayudar a graduar a sus hijos, mejorar su vehículo y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Heber is 29 years old and married. He and his wife have two children and they live in some part of the region Progreso, Yoro.

Heber used to work as a construction worker and in a bakery. With his experience he decided to start his own business of buying and selling bread. He has been doing this for 6 years: selling sweet and plain bread, juices, meringues, and distributing it to general stores with his vehicle.

He has requested two previous loans for his business with the credit bank. This is his third loan, requesting 15.000 Lempiras, with which he will buy bread in cash to sell and earn more money. His plan is to grow his business to help his children graduate, improve his vehicle and his house.

loans.use: to buy sweet and plain bread to resell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 35 years old married woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one son and two daughters and her husband is an auto repairing mechanic by profession. He has been running an auto repairing workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He has also spare parts in the workshop for exchange in auto during repairing. 

He needs to purchase some tools for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needful things. Therefore his wife, Safia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tyres, tubes, axels, brake shoes, etc. Safia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy workshop items like tyres, tubes, axels, brake shoes, etc. for her husband's auto workshop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single mother of 3 children who operates a retail shop in Hoima Uganda. In order to supplement her income she owns a business which has enabled her to provide for her children without fail. She hopes to grow her business and trade in wholesale to increase her profits, plus educating her children to university level. Mary is looking for a credit facility to buy more stock of items like sugar and saucepans to sell. However, capital limitation hinders her desires.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like sugar and saucepans to sell.

loans.name: Srey Yon

texts.en:
Srey Yon (shown in photo) is 24 years old, single, and lives with her family at Muk Kompul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. 

Nowadays, Srey Yon is a student who has studied at International University in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. In field of nursing, year 2, semester 1. She will graduate in 2016.

She would likes to apply for a loan for pay her school fees. She said that she wants to setup a clinic at her home.

loans.use: To pay for her school fees.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a hardworking man, aged 35 years old, a resident of Kishwahili, Mbarara with four children.  All his children are in good schools in Mbarara town schools. This gentleman has rentals and even agriculture, but has requested a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to buy manure for mulching his banana plantation.
 
He says he gets 50 batches per month and he thought developing it will give him more output, which will increase his earnings.

He is a hard working and resilient man. He appreciates Kiva's support and partnership.

loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
Aggrey lives in Hoima. He is aged 29, married, with two children and only one attends school. He started his piggery business alongside owning a motorcycle, which he uses for a transport business. He hopes to grow and expand his business as well as educate his children, although he faces challenges of a poor road network system that increases his expenditures of motorcycle repairs, and the high prices of animal feeds. 

He will use the loan facility to buy more piglets for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for rearing.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 54 years old, married, and had six children. She is managing a store for income. 

She wanted to improve her business and now asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy soft drinks and grocery items to sell. This will help improve her sales and earn good profits for her family. 

She will also continue extending good products and services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Nuevo Chalchihuapan Group

texts.es:
Cierta comunidad mexiquense es conocida por su vasto territorio que incluso está subdividido en cuatro regiones. Los habitantes de este lugar son muy alegres, amables y, sobretodo, muy trabajadores.
   La confianza en el equipo de VisionFund hizo que las integrantes del Grupo Chalchiuapan solicitaran un préstamo para desarrollar sus actividades. Ellas están comprometidas con el bienestar de sus familias y motivadas para ofrecer una mejor de calidad de vida a su familia. 
   En su comunidad, Florencia es conocida como Flor, está casada desde hace doce años con Luis quien trabaja en el campo y maneja un tractor, juntos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales se encuentran estudiando la educación primaria.
   Hace doce años Luis decidió iniciar el cultivo de plantas de ornato, aunque no pudo concluir su educación preparatoria aprendió muy a cultivar rosas, cuna de moisés, alcatraces y enredaderas. Flor, por su parte, se enfocó al negocio tiempo después para hacerlo crecer poco a poco. Toda la infraestructura del negocio la iniciaron con sus ahorros y ahora están solicitando un préstamo para comprar más macetas dado que sus plantas ya están listas para salir al mercado.
   Actualmente Flor ya no necesita comprar más plantas, siembra sus propios brotes y durante dos meses que dura el proceso, se encarga de cuidarlos para después ponerlos en venta. De esta manera Flor tiene asegurada una entrega cada semana; los clientes llegan hasta su invernadero para comprar flores o los mismos brotes. "Realmente me gusta mucho estar entre las plantas, no me puedo quejar porque es un muy buen negocio" comentó con alegría. Su sueño, es seguir trabajando y tener capital suficiente para instalar otro invernadero muy pronto.
   Flor se muestra gradecida con VisionFund ya que anteriormente obtuvo otros préstamos de la institución con los cuales logró comprar una camioneta para transportar y entregar algunos pedidos de flores.
   Las demás integrantes de Nuevo Chalchiuapan son Rosa quien invertirá en un invernadero de jitomates, Martina en plantas de ornato y Ma. Virginia en bordados.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el invernadero de Flor ella es quien viste el suéter rojo*
texts.en:
This Mexican community is known for its vast territory, which itself is divided into four regions. The inhabitants are very cheerful, friendly and most of all, very hardworking. Confidence in the VisionFund team led the members of the Chalchihuapan Group to request a loan to develop their businesses. They are committed to the wellbeing of their families and motivated to offer them a better quality of life.

	In her community, Florencia is known as Flor. She has been married for twelve years to Luis, who works in the fields and drives a tractor. Together they started a family with three children who are studying in elementary school. Two years ago, Luis decided to start cultivating decorative plants. Although he was unable to finish his preparatory studies, he learned much about the cultivation of roses, cuna de moisés, calla lilies and morning glories. For her part, Flor began to focus on the business some time later, in order to grow it little by little. They initiated the entire infrastructure of the business with their savings and are now requesting a loan to buy more flower pots, because their plants are ready to go to market.

	At the moment, Flor does not need to buy more plants as she sows her own shoots. During this two-month process, she is in charge of tending to them to later sell them. This way, Flor can be sure of a delivery every week. Customers come to her greenhouse to buy flowers or their sprouts. “In fact, I really like being among the plants, I can’t complain because it is a very good business,” she comments cheerfully. Her dream is to continue working and to have enough capital to install another greenhouse very soon.

	Flor expresses her gratitude to VisionFund, as she has previously received other loans from this institution, with which she was able to buy a small truck to transport and deliver flower orders.

	The other members of Nuevo Chalchihuapan are Rosa, who is going to invest in a tomato greenhouse, Martina, also in decorative plants, and Ma Virginia, investing in embroidery.

*The photo was taken at Flor’s greenhouse. She is the one in the red sweater.*

loans.use: to buy flower pots.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a cafeteria in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her cafeteria business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ursula dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria business

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rechel works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  

Rechel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to  buy fish to sell for her business for her buy-and-sell fish business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Rechel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 37 years old and she lives in frontier village Vazashen of Tavush region. Karine has specialty of hairdresser, but she never worked in that field and for many years she has been in farming activities with her husband, who greatly helps her; he also makes cargo transfers around the region. 

On the farm Karine has pigs, bee hives and chickens. For her farm products such as meat, honey and eggs, she has a lot of customers. Karine is also does good agricultural works and from her plot of land she gathers a harvest of beans, potatoes, persimmons, mulberries and figs. All the products she divides in two parts; for sale and for family use. 

She has a daughter (she is a student) and a school-aged son. 

Karine needs this loan in order to buy bulls, pigs and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy bulls, pigs and also fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is aged 57 years, and married; he has 18 children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies, and also grows cocoa. Charles is on retirement and gets a pension as additional income. 

He started the cocoa business to raise income for the family and he used the previous loan to pay school fees for the children; his main challenge is limited capital. His personal goals are  to finish his house, educate the children and support the family in getting basic needs. 

Charles has asked for a loan to pay for labor and buy building materials like sand, cement and timber to finish his  house.

loans.use: to pay labor and buy building materials to finish house

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres Las Madrecitas Group

texts.es:
Manuela con es una mujer de 28 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus tres hijos de las edades entre 3 y 10 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Xojolá.
Manuela (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa negra) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, él tiene seis años de realizar esta labor.
Manuela con el entusiasmo de superarse ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar más mercaderías de su negocio como cortes, fajas y güipiles, para poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
El gran sueño de Manuela es poder comprar un terreno para luego construir su casa para darles a sus hijos una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 28-year-old woman, single, who lives with her three children between the ages of 3 and 10. This humble family lives in a community in the village of Xojolá.

Manuela (the first on the left in the photo, wearing a black blouse), with the desire to get her income and get her family ahead, works purchasing and selling traditional clothing. She has been doing this work for six years. 

Manuela with the enthusiasm to improve herself has now decided to ask for a loan to be able to purchase more merchandise for her business such as cortes [woven skirts], sashes, and güipiles [embroidered tops] to be able to better satisfy her customers' needs and improve her income. 

Manuela's greatest dream is to be able to purchase land to then build a house to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing such as cortes [woven skirts], sashes, and güipiles [embroidered tops].

loans.name: Ana Marlena

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 54 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 29 y 12 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomás La Unión.
Ana con el objetivo de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, ella tiene treinta y cinco años de realizar esta labor. Pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la venta de comida y refacciones.
Ana por ser una mujer muy amable y respetuosa, en su tiendita tiene muchos clientes es por ello que ahora ha considerado solicitar un préstamo para comprar sus productos como frijol arroz, sal, azúcar, golosinas y gaseosas, para ofrecerle a sus clientes más productos.
Ana tiene el anhelo de ver a sus hijos graduados y ser grandes profesionales, para que tengan una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is a 54-year-old woman, married, and has a lovely family of four children between the ages of 29 and 12. This humble family lives in a community of Santo Tomás La Unión.

Ana, with the objective to earn income and get her family ahead, works buying and selling groceries. She has been doing this work for thirty-five years. But, to increase her income, she also works selling food and snacks.

Ana, because she is a very friendly and respectful woman, has many customers in her store and for this reason she now has decided to ask for a loan to purchase her products such as beans, rice, salt, sugar, sweets, and soft drinks, to offer her customers more products.

Ana has the desire to see her children graduate and be great professionals, so that they have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as beans, rice, salt, sugar, sweets, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Marfrid Alecsi

texts.es:
Marfrid es un hombre de 38 años de edad, es soltero vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Marfrid con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como guardián de una institución privada, él tiene un año de realizar esta labor. Pero para mejorar sus ingresos él cuenta con una tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes.
Marfrid ahora está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertirlo en su tienda de abarrotes comprando productos como arroz, azúcar, frijol, golosinas y gaseosas, porque gracias a Dios su negocio tiene mucha demanda, pues por tal razón solicita un préstamo.
El gran sueño de Marfrid es poder construir su casa de terraza, y comprarse más terreno.
texts.en:
Marfrid is a 38-year-old man; he is single and lives in a community of Santo Tomas La Unión.

Marfrid, with the desire to get income and get his family ahead, works as a security guard in a private institution. He has been doing this work for one year. But, to increase his income, he has a store where he buys and sells groceries.

Marfrid is now asking for a loan to be able to invest it in his grocery store, purchasing products such as rice, sugar, beans, sweets, and soft drinks because, thanks to God, his business has a lot of demand, so for this reason he asks for a loan.

Marfrid's greatest dream is to build a house with a terrace and purchase more land.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as rice, sugar, beans, sweets, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lucy Yanina

texts.es: Lucy tiene 37 años de edad, esta soltera y es docente de primaria en un colegio privado, además empezó a retomar el curso de maestría en psicopedagogía en la universidad, para así empezar a obtener nuevos puestos de mayor importancia en la institución donde labora actualmente. El préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar una herramienta de estudio y de trabajo (computadora) que tanto le hace falta para realizar sus actividades diarias. Uno de sus anhelos es seguir creciendo profesionalmente e implementar un taller donde puedan asistir los niños con problemas de aprendizaje. Ella se siente muy contenta y agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por el apoyo que se le brinda y pide encarecidamente que continúe con muchas personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en: Lucy is 37 years old, single, and is a primary school teacher at a private school. In addition, she began to continue her masters program in educational psychology at the university to begin to get new positions,which are more important, in the institution where she currently works. The granted loan will be invested in purchasing a tool for her studies and work (a computer) which she really needs to do her daily work. One of her desires is to continue growing professionally and establish a workshop where the children with learning challenges can attend. She feels very happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for the support that they offer and she asks urgently that they continue with many people who need it.

loans.use: to purchase a tool for her studies and work.

loans.name: Grupo Las Recomendadas De Pacamache Group

texts.es:
Catarina (es la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de blusa celeste) es una gran mujer que ahora tiene 32 años de edad, ella cuenta que le fue muy bien con el préstamo anterior pues gracias a ello logro comprar sus mercaderías y surtió más su negocio, y sus ingresos mejoraron, ahora nuevamente solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más mercaderías de ropa típica cortes, fajas y güipiles.
El gran sueño de Catarina es poder construir una casa y comprar más terrenos para sus hijos.
texts.en: Catarina (the first from the left in the photograph above wearing a blue blouse) is a great woman who is 32 years old. She reports that her last loan worked out very well for her because she was able to buy merchandise and stock her business. As a result, her profits increased. Now she is requesting another loan to be able to buy more traditional pieced of clothing: skirts, shorts, and güipiles (patterned textiles). Catarina's dream is to build a house and buy more land for her children.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Laura María

texts.es: Laura encontró una dinámica forma de exhibir en las redes sociales los productos que comercializa, esta joven de 19 años de edad ofrece bolsos, sandalias y productos de cuidado personal ofertados en catálogos especializados.  Sus contactos son sus principales clientes que en su gran mayoría son jóvenes universitarios, en cuanto logra obtener un número de encargos significativos realiza el pedido y entrega a sus clientes brindándoles facilidad de pago.  Esta forma de generar recursos le permite contar con mucho tiempo disponible para no descuidar sus estudios, por el contrario se mantiene conectada todo el día y cuando no les puede atender sus clientes le dejan mensajes los cuales ella responde en cuanto pueda.   En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir pedidos de sus clientes; bolsos de diseños juveniles, sandalias, cremas, perfumes y demás.  Con esta inversión Laura considera que le permitirá incrementar sus venta y con ello aumentar su capital de trabajo.  Laura desea terminar su carrera profesional para hacer un post grado y en su negocio continuar creciendo para tener un almacén.
texts.en: Laura found a dynamic way to show the products that she sells in the social networks. This young woman, 19 years old, sells bags, sandals and personal care products sold in specialized catalogs. Her contacts are her principal customers who, in the vast majority, are young university students. When she gets a significant number of orders, she makes the order and delivers them to her customers offering them payment terms. This way of generating resources allows her to have a lot of time available so as not to neglect her education. To the contrary, she stays online all day and when she can't serve her customers, they leave messages that she responds to when she can.
